0.title: India’s first mattress that keeps you 4° cooler: SleepyCat Ultima
0.article_body: SleepyCat has launched the new Ultima Mattress with Vir Das as the face of the campaign. It is India's first mattress with CoolTEC™ Fabric that lets you sleep 4° cooler, thanks to the fabric's ability to draw heat away from the body, stated the company. The mattress also provides 7-zone full body contoured support, through its DeepTouch™ Pressure Technology.

1.title: Mumbai man thrown off bridge in Vasai creek over affair, one held
1.article_body: The Mumbai Police arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly throwing a 20-year-old man from a bridge into Vasai creek as the latter was having an affair with his relative. The deceased, Deepak Katukar, was having an affair with a 19-year-old woman. As per Deepak's mother, the woman's parents did not like the relationship and had also lodged complaint against him.

2.title: Russian court upholds Navalny's 9-yr jail sentence for fraud
2.article_body: A Russian court rejected Opposition leader Alexei Navalny's plea against the nine-year prison sentence he had received for fraud. He would be moved from a penal colony to a high-security prison. He was found guilty of fraud, embezzlement and contempt of court. He is said to have defrauded his supporters by seeking donations to contest the presidential election.

3.title: 18-yr-old shooter posted pic of 2 rifles on Instagram before killing 19 children in US
3.article_body: The 18-year-old suspected shooter who shot and killed 19 school children and two adults at a Texas elementary school posted a photo of two AR15-style rifles on Instagram before Tuesday's massacre. Multiple classmates confirmed that the account belonged to Salvador Ramos, who was shot dead by officers responding to the school shooting. Authorities said the suspect acted alone.

4.title: Riyan Parag gives 'death stare' to Ashwin in anger after getting run out, video viral
4.article_body: RR batting all-rounder Riyan Parag gave a 'death stare' to Ravichandran Ashwin in anger after getting run out against GT in Qualifier 1 of IPL 2022 on Tuesday. Parag ran towards the striker's end after GT pacer Yash Dayal bowled a wide, while Ashwin did not move. Parag was seen gesturing to Ashwin, seemingly asking why he did not run.

5.title: Miller apologises to his former team RR after GT reach IPL final, RR react with a GIF
5.article_body: GT batter David Miller apologised to his former team RR after his team GT defeated them in Qualifier 1 to reach IPL 2022 final. "Sorry #RoyalsFamily," Miller tweeted. RR reacted with a GIF from 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', which read, "Dushman na kare dost ne wo kaam kiya hai. (Even an enemy won't do what a friend has done)."

6.title: US ride-hailing platform Lyft to slow hiring, no layoffs planned
6.article_body: US-based ride-hailing platform Lyft will be slowing down hiring and assessing budget cuts in some departments. Lyft said no employee layoffs are planned and added it would grant special stock options to eligible employees. Lyft shares have fallen more than 60% this year. "We're also being responsible about costs and will significantly slow hiring," the company said.

7.title: India imposes restrictions on sugar exports from June 1
7.article_body: Centre has imposed restrictions on sugar exports from June 1, Directorate General of Foreign Trade said. "To maintain domestic availability and price stability of sugar in the country during sugar season 2021-22 (October-September), central government to regulate sugar exports wef June 1, till further orders. Government will allow sugar exports up to 100 LMT," Ministry of Consumer Affairs said.

8.title: Wherever AAP goes, it takes corruption with it: BJP spokesperson
8.article_body: After the removal of Punjab Health Minister and AAP leader Vijay Singla, BJP spokesperson Gaurav Bhatia said it is only AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal who can give a "100% corruption rate". "The people of Punjab and the country are saying that wherever this party goes, it takes corruption with itself," Bhatia added.

9.title: My career has my mother's name attached, cannot tarnish it: Palak on Shweta
9.article_body: Talking about actress Shweta Tiwari, actress Palak Tiwari said, "I'm not only building this career in my name, it has my mother's name attached to it. Every step I take...[is] also impacting my mother's name." "I may get more opportunities because of my mother, but I need to...think, is this opportunity benefiting me or am I tarnishing my mother's name?"

10.title: 22-year-old man dies after bike hits speed breaker in Pune's Baner
10.article_body: A 22-year-old man in Pune who met with a road accident earlier this month has died while undergoing treatment, police said. Hazrat Ali Islam Shaikh met with an accident on May 3 after the bike he was riding hit a speed breaker near Kapil Malhar society in Baner. The Chaturshringi Police have lodged a case of accidental death.

11.title: Elon Musk's net worth drops below $200 billion again as Tesla share price tumbles
11.article_body: Elon Musk has again fallen out of the $200 billion club, according to the Bloomberg Billionaires Index. Musk, the world's richest person, saw his fortune drop by 5.4% to $192.7 billion on Tuesday as shares of Tesla Inc slid almost 7%. Musk last dipped below the $200 billion threshold in March.

12.title: India’s 1st manned space mission will be launched in 2023: Jitendra Singh
12.article_body: Union MoS (I/C) for Science and Technology Dr Jitendra Singh said that India's first manned space mission will be launched in 2023, which will be followed by other space missions. "India is...leading nation as far as application of space technology is concerned," he said. "No other country...has such...diverse application of space technology in development and infrastructure programmes," he added.

13.title: 39 killed in 1 day in rain-related incidents in UP, CM announces ₹4 lakh ex-gratia
13.article_body: As many as 39 people were killed in one day in rain-related incidents in Uttar Pradesh, the state government said on Tuesday. Four people each died due to drowning in Agra and Varanasi, and five people died due to lightning in Aligarh, Shahjahanpur, Banda and Lakhimpur Kheri. CM announced an ex-gratia of ₹4 lakh each for the families of deceased.

14.title: Waymap app to help blind people use Washington subway system
14.article_body: Waymap app which helps blind people use public transit will now help them use Washington subway system. It'll be deployed in phases with the goal of deploying it at up to 30 Metro train stations by September and across the entire Metro system by early 2023. The app does not use GPS and can operate regardless of cellphone signal strength.

15.title: Mumbai's BEST fleet to get 525 AC electric buses by December
15.article_body: Mumbai's Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) fleet is expected to get 525 AC electric buses by December this year. These will be part of a deal signed with Olectra Greentech Limited, a Hyderabad-based electric vehicle company, to deliver 2,100 electric buses over a period of 12 months. Notably, BEST is planning to have almost 100% electric fleet by 2027.

16.title: I do my work & disappear, doesn't mean I'm not around: Abhay Deol
16.article_body: When asked why he's picky when it comes to films, actor Abhay Deol said, "I've been around for 17 years. I've...done two films a year. So, that doesn't mean I'm not around." "I do my work and disappear...I'm in a system that has a light constantly shining on a star...but I chose to switch that light off," he added.

17.title: Hyderabad Police busts online cricket betting racket, arrests 3 people
17.article_body: Hyderabad Police has busted an online cricket betting racket within the limits of Kachiguda Police Station and arrested three people. Police recovered ₹25 lakh in cash, 11 line phones, six unused cell phones and five personal mobile phones from the accused. All of the accused are natives of Hyderabad and two were previously arrested in cricket betting cases, police said.

18.title: Most of house stuff bought by Gauri, you're not allowed to disrupt design: SRK
18.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan said that most of the stuff for his house is bought by his wife Gauri Khan. "You are not allowed to disrupt the design in the house because she is a wonderful designer," he said, adding that he understands technology best in the house. He also said that the aesthetics of his house are amazing.

19.title: Gujarat polls to be one-sided, don't see Congress anywhere: Hardik
19.article_body: Former Congress leader Hardik Patel, who quit the party days ago, said that the upcoming elections in Gujarat will be "one-sided" in BJP's favour. He added, "I don't see Congress anywhere." When asked if he was considering BJP as an option, Patel said, "Why shouldn't it be?" Patel further said that AAP has a better electoral strategy than Congress.

20.title: Spinner Maya's unusual bowling action in Women's T20 Challenge goes viral
20.article_body: Velocity spinner Maya Sonawane's unusual bowling action during her team's match against Supernovas in Women's T20 Challenge has gone viral on social media. "My neck is hurting by just looking at Maya Sonawane bowl," a fan commented. Several fans compared her action to the action of Paul Adams. "Proper frog in a blender stuff," wrote another user.

21.title: When in God's name will we stand up to gun lobby?: Biden after 19 children shot dead in US
21.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Wednesday tweeted, "As a nation we must ask: When in God's name will we stand up to the gun lobby?" He added, "It's time to turn this pain into action." This comes after an 18-year-old gunman killed at least 19 children and two adults after storming into an elementary school in US' Texas.

22.title: WeWork's Adam Neumann's climate tech firm Flowcarbon raises $70 mn
22.article_body: Blockchain-enabled carbon credit trading platform Flowcarbon, co-founded by WeWork Founder Adam Neumann, has raised $70 million. The company sells carbon credits and keeps a record of the transactions on the blockchain. The firm raised $32 million in the funding round led by Marc Andreessen and Ben Horowitz. The balance was raised through the sale of a token.

23.title: IMD predicts light rain and cloudy skies in Mumbai this week
23.article_body: The IMD has predicted more light rain for Mumbai this week. According to the 48 hours forecast, generally cloudy sky with the possibility of light rain or drizzle is likely in Mumbai. Further, the city is expected to record its first pre-monsoon showers in the coming week, with rain and thunderstorms predicted on May 28 and 29, IMD stated.

24.title: 16-yr-old boy forcibly converted, married to mother of 2 in UP
24.article_body: A 16-year-old boy in UP's Kanpur was allegedly forced to convert to Islam and marry a woman who was divorced two years ago and has two children. The boy's family came to know about the incident after they watched it on a video. Bajrang Dal and VHP approached the police after which four people, including the woman, were arrested.

25.title: 5 injured as under-construction stormwater drain collapses in B'luru
25.article_body: A stormwater drain collapsed near Kalidasa Circle in Bengaluru's Srinagar, injuring five workers. Of the five, a 24-year-old worker was severely injured, while the remaining four sustained minor injuries. The incident occurred when the workers were pouring a concrete slab to cover the drain. Local residents alleged the negligence of the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike caused the incident.

26.title: Beg India to reconsider wheat export ban: IMF chief Kristalina
26.article_body: Talking about India's wheat export ban, International Monetary Fund (IMF) chief Kristalina Georgieva said, "I do have an appreciation for the fact that India needs to feed nearly 1.35 billion people...but I would beg India to reconsider as soon as possible." "The more countries step into export restrictions, the more others would be tempted to do so," she told NDTV.

27.title: India calls for reversal of Taliban's 'cover faces in public' policy for Afghan women
27.article_body: India called for reversal of Taliban's "cover faces in public" policy for Afghanistan women following UN Security Council's statement on "increasing erosion of respect for human rights and fundamental freedoms of women and girls in the country." Ambassador of India to United Nations TS Tirumurti tweeted, "Deep concern on Taliban announcement that women should cover faces in public."

28.title: Implement order to pay equal wages to nurses: HC to Delhi govt
28.article_body: Delhi High Court has directed the Delhi government to implement an earlier court order regarding the wages of nurses in private hospitals. HC was hearing a plea claiming that the Delhi government has not enforced the circular ordering private hospitals to give salaries and allowances to its nurses, at par or close to those given to nurses in government hospitals.

29.title: 18-year-old gunman kills 19 children, 2 adults in mass shooting in a school in US
29.article_body: An 18-year-old gunman killed at least 19 children and two adults after storming into an elementary school in US' Texas. The gunman, who was later killed by police, had reportedly also shot his grandmother before opening fire at the Robb Elementary School in Uvalde. Authorities said the suspect was armed with a handgun, an AR-15 semi-automatic rifle and high-capacity magazines.

30.title: Unified MCD officials' postings to be completed in 15 days: Officials
30.article_body: The posting of employees in different wings of the unified Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) is likely to be completed in 15 days, officials said on Tuesday. Constant departmental meetings are being held to expedite the reshuffling and shape MCD's structure, the officials added. Meetings to explore possible solutions to strengthen the MCD's financial condition are also being held regularly.

31.title: Delhi govt extends validity of retail liquor licences by 2 months
31.article_body: Delhi government has extended the validity of existing licences of retail liquor vends till July 31 over a potential delay in approval of Excise Policy 2022-23, an excise department order stated. The policy has not yet gotten Delhi Lieutenant Governor's approval. Retail liquor vends will have to pay the licence fee for the extended period, the order further stated.

32.title: Miller smashes 3 sixes in a row in last over as GT defeat RR to reach IPL 2022 final
32.article_body: GT defeated RR by seven wickets in Qualifier 1 to reach IPL 2022 final in their first-ever season. David Miller smashed three sixes in a row in last over as GT chased down 189-run target in 19.3 overs to win the match. RR will now face the winner of the Eliminator between RCB and LSG in Qualifier 2 on Friday.

33.title: Can alter output target: Tata Steel CEO on 15% export tax on steel
33.article_body: Tata Steel CEO TV Narendran told Reuters that if the 15% export tax on some steel products remains in place for a long time, the company might have to review its production targets. "You will only build as much capacity as you need for the domestic market," Narendran stated. He added that in the medium-to-long term, India should "encourage" exports.

34.title: No need to panic about monkeypox: TN govt's appeal to people
34.article_body:
Tamil Nadu Minister for Health and Family Welfare Ma Subramanian said that no case of monkeypox has been reported in the state and urged people not to panic about the disease. 
"We have directed authorities to step up surveillance at all the airports including screening of passengers who arrive from African countries," the minister said.

35.title: Ashwin is having best IPL season of his life: Nikhil Chopra
35.article_body: Nikhil Chopra praised Ravichandran Ashwin for his performance in ongoing IPL, saying the RR spinner is having best season of his life with his contribution in both departments (batting and bowling). He added, "With many variations up his sleeve, he should be called a mystery spinner. In terms of batting...he has learned the skill to hit big shots in...death overs."

36.title: Tesla loses bid to move sexual harassment suit to arbitration in US
36.article_body: A US judge has rejected Tesla's bid to send a lawsuit alleging widespread sexual harassment at the company's California plant to private arbitration. As per plaintiff Jessica Barraza, workers and supervisors at the plant routinely made lewd comments and gestures to female employees and Tesla failed to address complaints. At least six similar cases are pending in California state court.

37.title: Shell causing 'extreme harm' to planet: UK consultant as she quits
37.article_body: Caroline Dennett, a UK-based safety consultant for Shell for 11 years, quit publicly while accusing the company of causing "extreme harm" to the planet. "I can no longer work for a company that ignores all...the risks of climate change," Dennett wrote on LinkedIn. She added, "Contrary to Shell's public expressions around net zero, they're...planning to explore and extract much more."

38.title: 3 civilians hurt as terrorists hurl grenades at security forces in J&K
38.article_body: Three civilians were injured on Tuesday after terrorists hurled grenades at a naka party of police and CRPF in the Yaripora area of Jammu and Kashmir's Kulgam. As per reports, the terrorists missed the target and the grenades exploded away from the police personnel. The injured have been shifted to a hospital, where their condition is said to be stable.

39.title: Won't allow illegal entry of migrants by land or sea: Greece
39.article_body: Greek Civil Protection Minister Takis Theodorikakos said that Greece wouldn't allow the illegal entry of migrants by land or by sea. The announcement comes after Greece witnessed a rise in attempted entries at the border from Turkey's coast over the past few days. Notably, Greece and Turkey have long been at odds over the issue of illegal entry of migrants.

40.title: $200 billion wiped off social media firms' market value after Snap's profit warning
40.article_body: Social media companies lost about $200 billion in market value on Tuesday after Snap's shares crashed over 40%. The sector-wide selloff was triggered after Snapchat's parent company said it is expecting to miss quarterly revenue and profit targets and will have to slow hiring. Shares of Meta Platforms, Pinterest, Twitter and Google-parent Alphabet were all down between 7% and 24%.

41.title: Male anchors in Afghanistan wear masks after Taliban orders female anchors to cover faces
41.article_body: Male news anchors in Afghanistan have launched a campaign on social media, days after the Taliban issued a decree ordering their female colleagues to cover their faces at work. As part of the campaign, the male anchors are seen donning a face mask during broadcast. They are also sharing photos of themselves with a hashtag reading #FreeHerFace.

42.title: Playing for India is everyone's dream: Bishnoi on being selected for SA T20Is
42.article_body: Spinner Ravi Bishnoi, who was selected in India's 18-member squad for five-match T20I series against South Africa, said, "I'm very excited because it's a good opportunity for me as playing for India is everyone's dream." The first T20I will be played on June 9. Bishnoi had made his India debut in first T20I against West Indies in February this year.

43.title: Medical trainee charred to death in ambulance in UP's Bulandshahr
43.article_body: A 26-year-old medical trainee was charred to death after a 102 ambulance he was driving caught fire in Uttar Pradesh's Bulandshahr district on Monday, an official said. The ambulance was on its way to pick up a pregnant woman from a village in the district. The victim was driving the vehicle since its driver was not available at that time.

44.title: Not 100% sure: Osaka on Wimbledon participation after ranking points sanction
44.article_body: Following ATP and WTA's decision to strip Wimbledon of ranking points after they excluded Russian and Belarusian players because of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Naomi Osaka said, "I'm not 100% sure if I'm going to go there." The four-time Grand Slam champion added, "I would say the decision is kind of affecting, like, my mentality going into grass."

45.title: Jewellery worth ₹15 lakh, cash stolen from a shop in Lucknow
45.article_body: Police said that a gang of thieves broke into a jewellery shop in Lucknow's Sarojininagar and stole ornaments worth over ₹15 lakh along with some cash. The incident took place at around 2 am on Tuesday, they said. The shop owner informed the police that 8.6 kg of silver jewellery, 215 grams of gold jewellery and ₹18,000 cash was stolen.

46.title: Nurses protest against privatising hiring process in Maharashtra
46.article_body: Nurses and nursing students across Maharashtra have started protests and have threatened to go on an indefinite strike from Saturday against privatising hiring process. A government resolution issued in April stated that 1,769 of 4,500 vacant posts under DMER could be filled by outsourcing the hiring to an external agency. Nurses are demanding that the government scrap this order.

47.title: Woman shouts at Johnny Depp 'This baby is yours' in courtroom, gets removed
47.article_body: Amid Johnny Depp and Amber Heard's defamation trial, a woman with a baby called out to Johnny that the child was his and was removed from the spectator gallery. She yelled that they were soul mates and asked him when he was going to acknowledge he was the father. The woman later claimed she was doing it as a joke.

48.title: Battles in eastern Ukraine could decide country's fate: Official
48.article_body: Ukrainian Defence Ministry spokesperson Oleksandr Motuzyanyk on Tuesday claimed that battles being fought in eastern Ukraine could determine the country's fate. "The situation on the (eastern) front is extremely difficult," he said. "Now we are observing the most active phase of the full-scale aggression which Russia unfolded against our country," Motuzyanyk added.

49.title: More BJP leaders waiting to join TMC: Arjun Singh after quitting BJP
49.article_body: Ex-West Bengal BJP's Vice-President Arjun Singh, who recently joined the TMC after quitting the BJP, on Tuesday claimed that more BJP leaders are waiting to join TMC. "Just wait and see what happens," he said. Reacting to his claims, BJP MP Locket Chatterjee said that TMC leaders are trying to create an atmosphere of mistrust in BJP's West Bengal unit.

50.title: Bengal man jailed in Nepal for carrying printouts of US currency
50.article_body: A 24-year-old photographer from West Bengal's Salkia has been imprisoned in Nepal since November last year for allegedly carrying printouts of US currency. The man, Durlav Roy Chowdhury, who stated that he needed printouts for a film shoot, further claimed that he was subjected to torture in prison. He's awaiting hearing of his case which will be held on Wednesday.

51.title: IPL 2022 title more important than the purple cap: RR's Chahal
51.article_body: RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal has said helping his side win IPL 2022 title is more important than winning the purple cap. Chahal is currently the leading-wicket taker in tournament with 26 wickets so far, just two wickets more than Wanindu Hasaranga. "Never thought much about the purple cap, plan was always to finish in...top two...happy to get that," he added.

52.title: ₹2 lakh ex-gratia for families of Hubli accident victims: PM Modi
52.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced an ex-gratia of ₹2 lakh each to the families of those who died in the collision between a passenger bus and a lorry in Karnataka's Hubli. "My thoughts are with the bereaved families. May the injured recover soon," PMO tweeted. "The injured would be given ₹50,000," another tweet by the PMO said.

53.title: 14 children aged 12-16 rescued from bangle-making unit in Jaipur
53.article_body: In a joint operation by the Bachpan Bachao Andolan activists, anti-human trafficking unit and local police, 14 children were rescued from a bangle-making unit in Jaipur's Bhatta Basti locality. Police said that all rescued children were between the ages 12 and 16 and were allegedly trafficked from various districts of Bihar. An FIR has been registered against the unit owners.

54.title: Export duty hike on iron ore to ensure steel supply for domestic use: Govt
54.article_body: Steel Secretary Sanjay Singh on Tuesday defended the government's move to increase export duty by 50% on iron ore and 15% on some steel intermediaries. Singh said the decision was taken to ensure that "domestically we can consume more than we produce". He added that the raw material problem was addressed by waiving import duty on coking coal and ferronickel.

55.title: 15-yr-old UP boy sentenced to service at cow shelter for hate post on CM
55.article_body: A Juvenile Justice Board in Uttar Pradesh has ordered a 15-year-old boy to perform community service at two public places. He has been ordered to serve at a cow shelter for 15 days and clean another public place for another 15 days. The boy had shared an objectionable post against CM Yogi Adityanath on social media a month ago.

56.title: 20 countries to provide fresh military aid to Ukraine: US
56.article_body: Twenty countries have pledged to provide fresh military aid to Ukraine to help it fight against Russia, US Defence Secretary Lloyd Austin announced on Monday. "Many countries are donating critically needed artillery ammunition, coastal defence systems and tanks," he said. The announcement was made after a meeting of 44 countries that are part of Ukraine Defense Contact Group.

57.title: China & Russia hold 1st joint military exercise since Ukraine war
57.article_body: China and Russia's air forces conducted their first joint aerial exercise over Sea of Japan, East China Sea and the Western Pacific, China's defence ministry said. The patrol, the first one since Russia invaded Ukraine in February, is part of annual military exercise, ministry added. Notably, Japan expressed concerns over Russian and Chinese fighter jets' presence near its airspace today.

58.title: Many AAP MLAs are in jail: Khattar on Punjab Minister's removal
58.article_body: After the removal of Punjab Health Minister and AAP leader Vijay Singla, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar criticised AAP, saying many of its leaders are in jail and many are removed under corruption charges. "The kind of party it is, nothing can be said...We have a stand-up policy, making people independent. They have a sit-down policy, giving freebies," he said.

59.title: BJP did nothing for Kashmiri Pandits' welfare: Mehbooba Mufti
59.article_body: Accusing BJP of exploiting the situation of Kashmiri Pandits, PDP President Mehbooba Mufti said BJP has done nothing for their welfare. She said Kashmiri Pandits were moved from tents to flats when Manmohan Singh was the PM. "When the situation was bad in 2016, we gave the Kashmiri Pandits salaries for 17 months while they were staying home," Mufti said.

60.title: SAIL posts its highest-ever revenue of ₹1.03 lakh crore in FY22
60.article_body: Steel Authority of India Ltd (SAIL) posted its all-time high revenue from operations of ₹1.03 lakh crore in the fiscal year ending March 31, 2022, the company said in a statement. It added that during FY22, SAIL clocked in its best-ever performance in production and sales. The company's profit after tax stood at ₹12,015 crore during the fiscal, it added.

61.title: Don't offer unserviceable flight seats for sale to passengers: DGCA warns airlines
61.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation has warned all the airlines against offering unserviceable seats to flyers on their domestic and international flights. "This practice is not only causing inconvenience to the travellers but also inviting a serious safety concern," the regulator asserted. A Delhi-London Air India flight was reportedly delayed after passengers complained about seat quality.

62.title: Google brings feature that shows how a place has changed to Maps app
62.article_body: Street View historical imagery, which allows users to see how a place has changed over the years, is being extended to Google Maps' iOS and Android apps, the company announced on Tuesday. The feature was only available on desktop version of Google Maps until now. As per Google, users can view imagery from as far back as 2007.

63.title: Audience is to blame for regressive content on TV: Actress Hina Khan
63.article_body: Actress Hina Khan, speaking about regressive TV shows, said, "I don't think the content which is made on television, for that you can blame the makers...it's the audience." Hina added that people do not watch progressive television shows. Hina said that nothing will change unless there's a change in attitude. "It'll take another 50 years [to change]," she concluded.

64.title: Cong forms task force for LS polls, adds strategist Sunil Kanugolu
64.article_body: Congress has constituted 'Task Force 2024' ahead of the 2024 Lok Sabha elections and roped in political strategist Sunil Kanugolu as a member. Senior party leaders including P Chidambaram, Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, Jairam Ramesh and Randeep Singh Surjewala are also members of this task force. Notably, this comes weeks after political strategist Prashant Kishor declined to join the party.

65.title: Idea that sustainable business is costly needs to go: Unilever CEO
65.article_body: Unilever CEO Alan Jope said the idea that sustainable business is costly needs to go. Speaking at a panel discussion at the World Economic Forum 2022 in Davos, Jope said, "Our sustainable brands...are growing much faster than the rest of our portfolio." Unilever's customers, particularly young people, are making brand choices based on social and environmental impact, he added.

66.title: Govt allows duty free import of crude soyabean, sunflower oils for 2 years
66.article_body: The Central government has allowed duty free import of crude soyabean oil and crude sunflower oil for a period of two years. A quantity of 20 lakh metric tonne of crude soyabean oil and crude sunflower oil each per year will incur a 'NIL' rate of customs duty and agricultural infrastructure and development cess, effective May 25, the government said.

67.title: Nepal inaugurates new school funded by Indian grant assistance
67.article_body: An Indian embassy official inaugurated a new school in Nepal's Pokhara on Tuesday, which has been funded by grants from India. The project, with an estimated cost of NPR 36.30 million (₹2.2 crore), is one of the 75 projects funded by India which are being inaugurated in Nepal this year. The school has been categorised as High-Impact Community Development Project.

68.title: Snap's shares crash 41% in their biggest-ever intraday decline
68.article_body: Shares of Snapchat's parent company Snap crashed over 41% on Tuesday, marking their biggest intraday decline ever since the company went public in 2017. The company's share price dipped below its initial public offering (IPO) price to as low as $13.55. Snap's stock crashed after the company cut its revenue and profit forecasts citing rising inflation and Russia-Ukraine war's impact.

69.title: Pics of PM Modi's gifts to US President and PMs of Japan & Australia released
69.article_body: PM Narendra Modi gifted Sanjhi artwork from Uttar Pradesh's Mathura to US President Joe Biden during their meeting at the Quad Summit in Japan on Tuesday. He gifted a Gond Tribal Art painting from Madhya Pradesh to newly-elected Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese. Japanese Prime Minister Fumio Kishida, meanwhile, was gifted a wooden hand-carved box with a Gujarati Rogan painting.

70.title: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus re-elected as WHO chief for second term
70.article_body: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus was re-elected as the Director-General of the World Health Organization (WHO) for a second five-year term on Tuesday by UN health agency's member countries. Notably, no other candidate had challenged Tedros for the post. "I'm deeply grateful for...trust and confidence of Member States. I thank all health workers and my WHO colleagues around the world," Tedros tweeted.

71.title: Was in critical condition, had to fight for life: Payal on depression
71.article_body: Actress Payal Ghosh, speaking about her battle with depression, has said, "I was in a very critical mental condition and had to fight for life." "If it hadn't been for my family and my own grit, I wouldn't have survived the years of battle," she added. Payal said depression "strikes silently" and added that she too was taken by surprise.

72.title: Will fight malicious, false accusations: Karti Chidambaram on CBI raids
72.article_body: Congress leader Karti P Chidambaram on Tuesday criticised the Centre for using its agencies to accuse him of a "malicious and completely fabricated charge". This comes after CBI raided properties owned by him and his father P Chidambaram in an ongoing visa corruption case. "Heading back home. Will fight the malicious, patently false accusations. The truth shall prevail," Karti tweeted.

73.title: PM Modi creating vision of India that excludes masses: Rahul
73.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said, "PM Narendra Modi is constructing a vision of India where he is leaving out huge chunks of our population." "I have a problem with it because it is completely unfair [and] because that is not what India is," Rahul said. "You have to include every single person with compassion," he added.

74.title: Old picture of Jupiter goes viral, IFS officer compares it to 'plain dosa'
74.article_body: An old image of Jupiter captured by NASA's Cassini spacecraft from the bottom is going viral on social media after being posted on Twitter by an account called Latest In Space. Several Twitter users pointed out that the image looked like that of a dosa. "Isn't it a plain dosa!!" IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted while commenting on the photo.

75.title: Yes, I have: Kartik Aaryan on if he has dated a Bollywood actress
75.article_body: Kartik Aaryan, during an interview, was asked if he has dated a Bollywood actress. To this, the actor replied, "Haan, kiya hai (Yes, I have)." This comes after Kartik, in another interview, was asked if his link-up reports with Sara Ali Khan were a promotional stunt for 'Love Aaj Kal 2', to which he had replied, "Not everything is promotional."

76.title: Dismissed Punjab Minister Singla sent to police remand till May 27
76.article_body: A Mohali court has sent former Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla to police remand till May 27 over corruption allegations against him. He was dismissed from the state cabinet on Tuesday and later arrested by the Anti-Corruption Branch. Singla was allegedly demanding a 1% commission from officials for contracts, CM Bhagwant Mann's office said.

77.title: 26 kids report tomato flu in Odisha; Bhubaneswar has highest cases
77.article_body: As many as 26 children have been diagnosed with tomato flu in Odisha, a health official said. Of these cases, 19 are reported from Bhubaneswar, three from Puri and two each from Cuttack and Puri. It is caused by intestinal viruses and its symptoms include fever, painful sores in the mouth and rash with blisters on hands, feet and buttocks.

78.title: Rajiv not with us to see appreciation for Toolsidas Junior: Ashutosh
78.article_body: Filmmaker Ashutosh Gowariker has called it unfortunate that late veteran actor Rajiv Kapoor is not with us to see the appreciation he is getting for his performance in his last film 'Toolsidas Junior'. Ashutosh added that they had already shown him the film before he passed away. 'Toolsidas Junior' marked Rajiv's comeback to films after 30 years.

79.title: World no. 2 Medvedev wins 1st round, Shapovalov loses at French Open
79.article_body: World number two Daniil Medvedev defeated Argentina's Facundo Bagnis 6-2, 6-2, 6-2 in first round at French Open on Tuesday. It was Medvedev's first win since undergoing hernia surgery almost two months ago. He had lost his opening-round match at Geneva Open last week on his return. Meanwhile, 19-year-old Holger Rune of Denmark beat 14th-seeded Denis Shapovalov 6-3, 6-1, 7-6(7-4).

80.title: Houses of Andhra Minister, MLA set on fire amid violence over renaming district
80.article_body: Protesters have set houses of Andhra Pradesh Transport Minister Pinipe Viswarup and MLA Ponnada Satish on fire as violence broke out in Amalapuram over the renaming of newly created Konaseema district as BR Ambedkar Konaseema district, local media reports stated. A police vehicle and an educational institution's bus were also torched. Several policemen were reportedly injured in the violence.

81.title: Amit Shah to attend special screening of 'Prithviraj': Report
81.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah will be attending a special preview screening of Akshay Kumar-starrer Prithviraj in Delhi in June, reported Hindustan Times. As per the report, the audience of the screening will include Cabinet Ministers, senior politicians and high-ranking bureaucrats. The film is directed by Padma Shri recipient Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi and marks the debut of Manushi Chhillar.

82.title: All 3 teams above RCB will be wary of them in playoffs: Irfan
82.article_body: Speaking about RCB, who were the last team to qualify for playoffs in IPL 2022, Irfan Pathan stated that all three teams, GT, RR and LSG, above RCB are wary of Faf du Plessis-led side now. "They (RCB) are coming on the back of an emphatic win in their previous game," he added. They'll face LSG in Eliminator on Wednesday.

83.title: J&K LG meets Kashmiri Pandits protesting over Rahul Bhat's killing
83.article_body: J&K Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha on Monday met Kashmiri Pandits protesting over the killing of government employee Rahul Bhat, who was killed by terrorists on May 12. One of the primary demands of the protesters is posting of Kashmiri Pandits working for J&K administration outside Kashmir. "Instructions have been issued to move you to safer locations," Sinha told the protesters.

84.title: 11 killed in late-night shootings in 2 bars in Mexico, handwritten signs left
84.article_body: Eleven people were killed in simultaneous shooting attacks on two bars in north-central Mexico, authorities said on Tuesday. Handwritten signs left at the scenes of the killings suggested the attacks were part of a rivalry between two drug cartels that have been battling for control of Guanajuato state for several years. Eight of the victims were women.

85.title: Raj CM approves proposal to eliminate job interviews for most services
85.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot has approved the elimination of job interviews from the recruitment process for most services. Interviews will continue for posts under Rajasthan State and Subordinate Services (Direct Recruitment by Combined Competitive Examination) Rules, 1999, among some other posts. According to a statement, amendment in the rules will bring transparency in the recruitment process.

86.title: Nepotism hasn't worked in my favour, talent rules in this age: Adhyayan
86.article_body: Actor Adhyayan Suman, who is the son of actor Shekhar Suman, said, "Nepotism hasn't ever worked in my favour." He further stated that debate over nepotism in Bollywood has "always been futile". "Today, Kartik Aaryan receives as much love for 'Bhool Bhulaiyaa 2' as Alia Bhatt receives for 'Gangubai Kathiawadi'. Talent and content rule supreme in this age," he added.

87.title: Colombia soldiers to train Ukrainian military on landmine removal
87.article_body: Colombia's Defence Minister Diego Molano Aponte on Monday said that a team of Colombian soldiers will travel to Europe to train Ukraine's military on techniques to remove landmines. The experts from Colombia, which is a NATO partner, were invited to give the training by the US, he added. Colombia is one of the world's most-mined countries, according to the UN.

88.title: Assam CM visits flood-hit district Dima Hasao, reviews situation
88.article_body: Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma visited state's flood and landslide-hit Dima Hasao district and reviewed the situation there on Tuesday. Sarma visited relief camps set up at schools in district's Haflong, where 80 houses were destroyed due to torrential rains earlier this month. At least 24 people died and over 7 lakh others were affected due to floods in Assam.

89.title: Mahindra honoured at US college where his father was the 1st Indian graduate
89.article_body: Businessman Anand Mahindra was honoured with the Dean's Medal at Tufts University's The Fletcher School, 75 years after his father Harish Mahindra became the first-ever Indian graduate of the college. Sharing pictures from the ceremony, Mahindra said, "In the 75th year of Indian Independence, I was honoured to be the first Indian to address the School's Class Day."

90.title: Rubbish, it's 10-yr-old story: Sumona on rumoured wedding with Samrat
90.article_body: Actress Sumona Chakravarti, reacting to rumours of her wedding with Bengali actor Samrat Mukerji, called them "rubbish", adding that these are "10-year-old stories from social media". The actress further said that she will make an announcement if there is any such development in her life. "Frankly, no comments, I don't like to talk about my personal life," Sumona added.

91.title: J&K govt removes Sheikh Abdullah's photograph from police medals
91.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir (J&K) government has decided to remove the photograph of National Conference (NC) founder and ex-CM of the erstwhile state of J&K Sheikh Mohammad Abdullah from the J&K Police Medals for both gallantry and meritorious service. The J&K state emblem has also been removed from the medals. Abdullah's photograph will be replaced with the Indian government's National Emblem.

92.title: 'Aquaman' actor Jason Momoa shares picture getting MRI scan
92.article_body: Actor Jason Momoa, who portrays 'Aquaman', shared a picture of himself getting an MRI scan. He wrote, "You got to break some eggs to make an omelette." The actor is doing "okay" and got the MRI as "a precaution", reported People. Jason earlier had surgery to remove a hernia one day before appearing on the 94th Academy Awards red carpet.

93.title: Saudi Arabia reports limited progress in talks with Iran
93.article_body: Saudi Arabia's Foreign Minister Prince Faisal bin Farhan Al Saud on Tuesday said that there had been limited progress in talks with Iran. The Saudi minister also said that Saudi Arabia's hands remain outstretched to Iran. The talks began last year and are aimed at defusing tensions between the two regional rivals.

94.title: People in B'wood thought I was too skinny & said 'make her fat': Madhuri
94.article_body: Actress Madhuri Dixit has said that people in Bollywood thought that she was "too skinny" when she joined the industry. "During my time...they thought I was too skinny, to begin with. 'Yeh heroine, isko thoda mota karo (make this heroine a little fat)', they used to say," Madhuri stated. "I don't think that that's an issue now," she further added.

95.title: 'Manchester United are rubbish' appears on screen during broadcast, BBC blames trainee
95.article_body: The BBC has apologised after a message appeared during a broadcast on its news channel saying 'Manchester United are rubbish'. The channel blamed a trainee for the gaffe, with a presenter saying that the mistake had occurred as someone was learning how to operate the ticker and was "writing random things not in earnest".

96.title: India has immense talent, but one has to look hard to find it: Ganesh
96.article_body: Choreographer-actor Ganesh Acharya has said that there is "immense talent" in India. "But one has to look hard enough to find these hidden gems," he added. "I have also struggled in my younger years and was given an opportunity that has made me the Ganesh Acharya that I'm today," he further said. Ganesh will next be seen in 'Dehati Disco'.

97.title: World lost 11.2 crore jobs in first quarter of 2022: ILO report
97.article_body: The number of hours worked globally in the first quarter of 2022 dropped to 3.8% below the employment situation before the pandemic, a report by International Labour Organisation (ILO) revealed. The report said this is equivalent to a deficit of 11.2 crore full-time jobs. It cited fresh lockdowns in China, Ukraine-Russia conflict and inflation as the reasons for the findings.

98.title: Pics of Chinese & Russian jets near Japan during PM Modi's Quad meet released
98.article_body: Japanese Defense Ministry on Tuesday released the pictures of Chinese and Russian fighter jets that flew near Japanese airspace during the Quad meet, which was also attended by PM Narendra Modi. Japan conveyed "grave concerns" to Russia and China through diplomatic channels. A Russian TU-95 bomber, Chinese H-6 bombers and Russian IL-20 information gathering warplane were reportedly among the jets.

99.title: The richer someone is, the fewer kids they have, I'm an exception: Musk
99.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "Contrary to what many think, the richer someone is, the fewer kids they have." The 50-year-old father of seven children said he's "a rare exception", adding that "most people I know have zero or one kid". Musk earlier said that the belief that having fewer children is better for the environment is "total nonsense".

100.title: J&K Police bust Jaish-e-Mohammed module in Awantipora, arrest 8
100.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Police along with security forces busted a terror module of proscribed terrorist outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) in Awantipora by arresting eight terrorist associates. Police have also recovered incriminating materials, including ammunition, from their possession. Police have launched an investigation into the matter.

101.title: Pakistani govt bans ex-PM Imran Khan's protest march to Islamabad
101.article_body: Pakistan's Interior Minister Rana Sanaullah on Tuesday announced a ban on a planned protest march by ex-PM Imran Khan and his supporters to the country's capital Islamabad. The ban was announced after a policeman was killed during a crackdown on Khan's supporters across the country. "No one would be allowed to siege the capital and dictate his demands," Sanaullah said.

102.title: 3 Delhi tourists including 2 siblings drown in Ganga in Rishikesh
102.article_body: Three tourists from Delhi, including a brother-sister duo, drowned in Ganga river in Shivpuri on Uttarakhand's Rishikesh-Devprayag stretch on Tuesday. According to State Disaster Response Force (SDRF) officials, the deceased were part of a nine-member group of tourists. The incident took place when the three persons went to bathe in the river, where water level had increased due to rainfall.

103.title: GT skipper Hardik hasn't looked fully fit while bowling in IPL 2022: Kaif
103.article_body: Talking about Hardik Pandya, Mohammad Kaif said GT captain hasn't looked fully fit while bowling in ongoing IPL, adding he hasn't bowled in every match. "Hardik not bowling regularly is a cause for concern because when he's selected for India, it's as an all-rounder," he added. Hardik was named in India's T20I squad for upcoming five-match series against South Africa.

104.title: AAP's CM face in Goa polls Amit Palekar to head state committee
104.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Tuesday announced that its chief ministerial candidate in the recently-held Goa Assembly polls, Amit Palekar, will head the party's new committee in the state. Additionally, AAP MLAs Capt Venzy Viegas and Cruz Silva will serve as the working presidents of the executive committee. AAP won two seats in the Goa elections.

105.title: Video shows Tesla car on fire in Canada, driver says 'had to break window to escape'
105.article_body: A video has surfaced online showing a Tesla Model Y on fire in Vancouver, Canada. According to the car's owner Jamil Jutha, the car lost power and shut down after warning of an "error". Jutha claimed the car started filling up with toxic smoke coming through vents, prompting him to break the window to escape as the doors wouldn't open.

106.title: My father's death was the single biggest learning experience of my life: Rahul
106.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has said the death of his father and the former PM of India Rajiv Gandhi was "the single biggest learning experience" of his life. His father's death caused him "tremendous pain", Rahul said, adding, "But...I can't get away from the fact that [it] also made me learn things that I would never ever have learnt otherwise."

107.title: Pic shows UK PM Boris Johnson drinking at party during lockdown in the country
107.article_body: Photographs of UK Prime Minister Boris Johnson drinking at a Downing Street gathering when the country was under lockdown have emerged. The photos, published by ITV News, show Johnson proposing a toast with a group of people next to a table with several bottles of alcohol and party food. They were taken at an event in November 2020, ITV said.

108.title: UP man arrested for sending obscene pictures to female Mumbai doctor
108.article_body: A 24-year-old man from Uttar Pradesh has been arrested for allegedly sending obscene pictures to a female doctor employed at a hospital in Mumbai's Bandra, police said on Tuesday. Police are on the lookout for the accused's accomplice, who is a former ward boy of the hospital. Police found the accused was using his younger brother's phone for the crime.

109.title: Sports and cinema have the power to unite India: Ayushmann Khurrana
109.article_body: Actor Ayushmann Khurrana has said that sports and cinema have the power to unite India. "I have closely seen how sports brings people together in celebration and I have also witnessed how cinema can be the unifier of audiences," he said. "They transcend identities and evoke the feeling of being one in that moment," he added.

110.title: 5 people die after consuming suspected spurious liquor in Bihar
110.article_body: At least five people died after they allegedly consumed suspected spurious liquor in Bihar's Aurangabad district, an official said on Tuesday. According to Aurangabad SP Kantesh Kumar Mishra, all deaths have been reported from the Madanpur block. Police have destroyed many illegal distilleries and arrested 67 suspected bootleggers following the incident, Mishra said.

111.title: BESCOM assures waiver of fixed electricity charges to B'luru hotels
111.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) has assured waiver of fixed electricity charges to hotels and restaurants in Bengaluru. The waiver of fixed electricity charges was extended to hotels and restaurants during COVID-19 pandemic for a period of three months from April-June 2021. Meanwhile, BESCOM has provided 11 WhatsApp helpline numbers for consumers to lodge complaints.

112.title: RR peaking at right time, GT's performances have gone down: Kaif
112.article_body: Ahead of Qualifier 1 between GT and RR in IPL 2022, Mohammad Kaif said RR are peaking at the right time and GT's performances have gone down in the last few matches. "They (RR) are learning to win matches even without major contributions from Jos Buttler," he added. GT have lost three of their last five matches.

113.title: Argentinian Prez, First Lady pay $24,000 fine over lockdown party
113.article_body: Argentinian President Alberto Fernández and First Lady Fabiola Yáñez on Monday paid a fine of 30 lakh pesos (about $24,000) over a birthday dinner during a COVID-19 lockdown. Notably, the fine will be donated to Argentina's Malbran Institute, a prestigious vaccine research institute. The gathering amid social restrictions had sparked a scandal in the country.

114.title: India suffer their first defeat in men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey, lose 2-5 to Japan
114.article_body: India on Tuesday suffered their first defeat in men's Asia Cup 2022 hockey after losing 2-5 to Japan. Japan scored in the 24th, 40th, 49th, 54th and 56th minutes, while India's goals came in the 45th and 50th minutes. Pawan Rajbhar and Uttam Singh scored for India. India will next face Indonesia on Thursday.

115.title: Raj man files domestic abuse complaint after wife beats him with bat
115.article_body: A man in Rajasthan's Alwar has filed a domestic abuse complaint against his wife, accusing her of beating him with a cricket bat. A local court has directed police to probe the case and make security arrangements for the man, who alleged that his wife frequently beats him for no reason. The couple has been married for nine years.

116.title: HC seeks Delhi Police reply on Punjab's plea to quash Bagga abduction FIR
116.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Tuesday sought the response of Delhi Police on a plea by Punjab Police seeking to quash an FIR against them for allegedly abducting BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga. Punjab Police had on May 6 arrested Bagga from his Delhi residence on a complaint alleging that Bagga had threatened CM Arvind Kejriwal during a protest.

117.title: India considers tax cut on soybean and sunflower oils: Report
117.article_body: India is considering cutting an import levy on soybean and sunflower oils amid surging prices of food, Bloomberg reported on Tuesday. The government is weighing whether to reduce the agriculture infrastructure and development cess, currently at 5%, or abolish it, the report said. A decision on the matter could be taken this week, Bloomberg quoted a source as saying.

118.title: Former NSE CEO Chitra Ramkrishna gets ₹3.12 crore demand notice from SEBI
118.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) has issued a notice to NSE's former CEO Chitra Ramkrishna asking her to pay ₹3.12 crore in a case related to governance lapses at the stock exchange. The SEBI has warned Ramkrishna of arrest and attachment of assets and bank accounts if she fails to pay the penalty amount within 15 days.

119.title: GT to bowl first against RR in IPL 2022 Qualifier 1, playing XIs announced
119.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya won the toss and elected to bowl first against Rajasthan Royals (RR) in the Qualifier 1 of IPL 2022 at Eden Gardens in Kolkata. GT have made one change to their playing XI, with Alzarri Joseph replacing Lockie Ferguson. RR are fielding an unchanged side.

120.title: Ex-Maha BJP MLA booked for ‘disproportionate assets’ worth ₹8 cr
120.article_body: Officials said the Maharashtra Anti-Corruption Bureau (ACB) has registered an FIR against former BJP MLA Narendra Mehta and his wife, Suman, for allegedly having "disproportionate assets" worth ₹8.25 crore. The ACB, in its complaint, stated that while serving as an MLA from Mira-Bhayandar Vidhan Sabha seat and corporator of MBMC, Mehta misused his official positions and amassed illegal assets.

121.title: BJP criticises Rahul for meeting 'anti-India' British MP; Cong replies
121.article_body: The BJP on Tuesday criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for meeting British MP Jeremy Corbyn, who is known for his "anti-India" and "anti-Hindu" remarks and for advocating the separation of Kashmir from India. Meanwhile, Congress' Randeep Singh Surjewala, while sharing a picture of PM Narendra Modi with Corbyn, asked, "Does it mean PM has endorsed Jeremy Corbyn's views on India?"

122.title: Lack of protection was my biggest wound in relationships: Jada Pinkett
122.article_body: Actress Jada Pinkett Smith said lack of protection was her "biggest wound" in all her relationships. "I've looked for [the] craziest kind of protection, and I don't have a really good sense of what's safe and what's not," she added. In March, Jada's husband Will Smith had slapped Chris Rock at the Oscars over a joke on Jada's shaved head.

123.title: Umran can become an asset for India, needs to be used effectively: Sehwag
123.article_body: Ex-India opener Virender Sehwag has called Umran Malik a "special talent", saying the SRH pacer can become an "asset" for the Indian team after he was included in India's 18-member squad for T20I series against South Africa. He added Umran needs to be used "carefully" and "effectively" by  captain KL Rahul for the upcoming five-match T20I series.

124.title: Unlike shakhas, madrasas teach empathy: Owaisi on Assam CM's remarks
124.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi criticised Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma over his madrasa comments saying, "unlike Shakhas, they [madrasas] teach self-respect and empathy." Owaisi further tweeted, "Obsessing over Muslim ancestry shows your inferiority complex. Muslims have enriched India and will continue to do so." Earlier, the Assam CM said madrasas should cease to exist.

125.title: Taliban announces deal with UAE firm to manage Afghan airports
125.article_body: Taliban on Tuesday announced a deal with a UAE firm to manage three airports in Afghanistan after the fall of the country's US-backed government last year. Under the deal, UAE's GAAC Solutions will manage the airports in Herat, Kabul and Kandahar, the Taliban said. This move comes amid Taliban's past negotiations with Turkey and Qatar on the management of airports.

126.title: Punjabi language test made mandatory for Group C & D posts in Punjab
126.article_body: The Punjab government on Tuesday said it will now be mandatory for those applying for Group C and D posts to clear a Punjabi language test with at least 50% marks. The decision has been taken to promote the state language, as per an official statement. It was decided by Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann in a meeting.

127.title: 'Taarak Mehta...' fame Disha Vakani welcomes second child
127.article_body: Actress Disha Vakani, known for portraying Dayaben in television show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', recently welcomed her second child. Her husband Mayur Padia and brother and former co-star Mayur Vakani have confirmed the news. Pictures of the actress' baby bump had gone viral in December. Disha and Mayur got married in 2015 and welcomed their first child in 2017.

128.title: Fashion designer jumps to death from building in Gurugram
128.article_body: A 25-year-old fashion designer allegedly jumped to death from the 14th floor of Gurugram's Valley View Estate, police said on Tuesday. The deceased, Charu Khurana, was a native of Haryana's Karnal and had moved to Gurugram in search of a job. Prima facie, it appears to be a case of suicide but we're probing all angles, a police official said.

129.title: Abhay calls Kashyap 'gaslighter' after director said he was 'difficult to work with'
129.article_body: Abhay Deol has called filmmaker Anurag Kashyap a "gaslighter" in an interview. Without taking anyone's name, Abhay revealed how he didn't like marketing himself, as he wanted the film to speak for itself. However, he mentioned he was "gaslit" into thinking he didn't care enough for the film. Previously, Anurag said it was "painfully difficult" to work with Abhay.

130.title: Velocity record highest successful chase in Women's T20 Challenge history, beat Supernovas
130.article_body: Deepti Sharma-led Velocity recorded the highest successful chase in Women's T20 Challenge history by chasing down a target of 151 against Harmanpreet Kaur-led Supernovas on Tuesday. Opener Shafali Verma and Laura Wolvaardt scored 51(33) and 51*(35) respectively for Velocity, while their bowler Kate Cross recorded figures of 4-0-24-2. Velocity will face Smriti Mandhana-led Trailblazers on Thursday.

131.title: Chinese, Russian fighter jets fly nearby as PM Modi meets Quad leaders in Japan
131.article_body: Japan on Tuesday expressed "grave concerns" over Chinese and Russian fighter jets carrying out a patrol near its airspace as PM Narendra Modi met other leaders of the Quad group in Tokyo. The planes, however, did not breach Japan's territorial airspace, its Defence Ministry said. It called the patrol "provocative" in light of the Quad regional security summit.

132.title: ₹24.5 lakh cash stolen from a parked car in Navi Mumbai mall
132.article_body: The Vashi Police have registered a case after ₹24.5 lakh cash was stolen from a car parked in the parking lot of Inorbit Mall. Police said that the complainant, a businessman, parked the car and went shopping with his wife. When he returned, he found that the bag with the cash was missing and the rear window glass was broken.

133.title: Gurugram records 73.4mm rainfall in 24hrs, highest in May in 25yrs
133.article_body: Gurugram received 73.4 mm rainfall in the last 24 hours, the highest rainfall the city has received in May in 25 years. The previous highest rainfall for May was recorded at 53 mm in 1987, said Manmohan Singh, Director, India Meteorological Department, Chandigarh. "The entire state recorded heavy rainfall on Monday, but it was largely significant in Gurugram," Singh added.

134.title: Zomato shares record best day since market debut, close 14% higher
134.article_body: Shares of homegrown food delivery startup Zomato on Tuesday recorded their best day since the stock market debut in July last year. Zomato shares closed 14.72% higher on NSE on Tuesday after soaring 18% during intraday trading. The company's shares gained despite Zomato reporting a net loss of ₹359.7 crore for the fourth quarter, while its revenue surged 75% year-on-year.

135.title: Uttar Pradesh Assembly pays tribute to singer Lata Mangeshkar
135.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Assembly paid tributes to singer Lata Mangeshkar who passed away in February this year. Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath expressed grief and said, "The art and music world has suffered an irreparable loss with the passing away of Lata Mangeshkar." Members of the Assembly also remembered 11 former members of the Legislative Assembly, who passed away recently.

136.title: Viral pic shows PM Modi walking in front of US Prez, Australian PM; ministers react
136.article_body: A picture showing PM Narendra Modi walking in front of US President Joe Biden and Australian PM Anthony Albanese at the QUAD meet is going viral on social media. Reacting to the image, Union Minister Smriti Irani said, "Pradhan Sevak- knows the way, goes the way, shows the way." "Leading from the front...our PM," said Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw.

137.title: Ajay Devgn's name cleared from'De De...' false advertisement case
137.article_body: A consumer forum in Rajasthan's Ajmer has granted relief to Ajay Devgn by clearing his name in the false advertisement case against 2019 film 'De De Pyaar De'. The complainant is suing the film's makers, saying that the stunt on a poster was not performed in the film. The court has ruled that actors have nothing to do with posters.

138.title: People dying in floods but Assam CM busy with hate speech: Owaisi
138.article_body: Reacting to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma's 'madrasa' remark, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said, "18 people have died in Assam and seven lakh have been affected due to floods, but he's (Himanta) busy with hate speech." "They (BJP)...have hate for Islam and Muslims," he added. Earlier, Himanta had said, "Admitting children in madrasas is a violation of their human rights."

139.title: 2 dead, 120 injured in gas cylinder blast in Abu Dhabi restaurant
139.article_body: A gas cylinder explosion in a restaurant in United Arab Emirates' Abu Dhabi has killed two people and injured 120 others, the police said on Monday. The blast set off a fire that damaged the facades of six buildings before being brought under control, they added. Four of the damaged buildings were safely evacuated, they further said.

140.title: Johnny Depp gave me CPR after I overdosed in 1995: Courtney Love
140.article_body: Singer Courtney Love revealed actor Johnny Depp saved her life outside the Viper Room in 1995. Courtney's friend Jessica Reed Kraus shared a series of videos on Instagram in which the singer said she doesn't want to make her judgments on Depp's defamation trial publicly. "Johnny gave me CPR in 1995 when I overdosed outside the Viper Room," Courtney added.

141.title: Adani Green to invest ₹60,000 crore in Andhra, create 10,000 jobs
141.article_body: Adani Green Energy has signed an MoU with Andhra Pradesh government to set up projects worth around ₹60,000 crore in the state. The renewable energy company will set up a 3,700 MW pumped storage hydro power plant and a 10,000 MW solar power project. The projects are expected to create direct and indirect employment for 10,000 people.

142.title: Assam custodial death victim's wife, 4 others booked under UAPA
142.article_body: Assam Police has arrested six persons, including the wife and daughter of a fish trader who allegedly died in police custody, for allegedly burning down a police station. The other accused are also relatives of the deceased, Nagaon SP said. Police said five of the six accused have been booked under Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) for suspected terror links.

143.title: Policeman killed, his 7-yr-old daughter injured in terrorist attack in Srinagar
143.article_body: A policeman was killed and his seven-year-old daughter was injured after terrorists opened fire at them in Jammu and Kashmir's Srinagar, police said. Saifullah Qadri succumbed to his injuries while being taken to the hospital while his daughter has been hospitalised, they added. The attack took place in Soura area of Srinagar.

144.title: Credit to RR for showing faith in Ashwin's all-round abilities: Harbhajan
144.article_body:
Crediting RR for showing faith in Ravichandran Ashwin's all-round abilities in IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh said it's the "best" franchise to have ever made full use of the bowling all-rounder.  
"No franchise has ever utilised Ashwin's batting talent before but this team has promoted him up in the batting order and he's won them a match with...bat," he added.

145.title: Beggar buys ₹90,000 bike after wife complains of backache in MP
145.article_body: A man from Madhya Pradesh's Chhindwara district spent his life savings to buy a bike worth ₹90,000 after his wife complained of backache from sitting on a tricycle they own. The man, identified as Santosh Kumar Sahu, stated that the couple can now travel to various locations in their new vehicle. Sahu, who's reportedly physically disabled, earns money through begging.

146.title: Parents of sexual offence victim can't enter into compromise with accused: High Court
146.article_body: Punjab and Haryana High Court has said that parents of a child who is a victim of a sexual offence cannot enter into a "compromise" with the accused. "Parents cannot be allowed to compromise the dignity of a child by an agreement," the court asserted. The court was hearing a petition seeking quashing of an FIR registered under POCSO Act.

147.title: Mumbai Police chief to interact live with citizens on social media
147.article_body: Mumbai Police Commissioner Sanjay Pandey will interact with citizens during a live session on Facebook and YouTube on Wednesday evening, Mumbai Police said on Twitter. Pandey will discuss policing-related issues with the common people and listen to their complaints during the live session. Notably, Pandey conducts a Facebook live session every Sunday.

148.title: Police issue traffic advisory ahead of PM Modi's visit to Hyd
148.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police have issued a traffic advisory for commuters ahead of PM Narendra Modi's visit to the Indian School of Business (ISB) in Hyderabad on May 26 (Thursday). Reportedly, police have also banned the use of remotely controlled drones or para-gliders or remotely controlled microlight aircraft within a five-kilometre radius of the ISB and the Gachibowli Stadium.

149.title: One of the things I'm allowed to do at home is buy TVs: SRK
149.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan has stated that he doesn't disrupt the design at his house since his wife Gauri Khan "is a wonderful designer". He said, "One of the...things that I'm allowed to do...[is] that whenever I go and buy a television, (I can) put it in any room." He added it's because he knows technology the best at home.

150.title: Ajay Kothiyal, who was AAP's Uttarakhand CM face, joins BJP
150.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party's CM candidate for recently-held Uttarakhand Assembly elections Ajay Kothiyal on Tuesday joined the BJP in Dehradun. He joined the party in the presence of Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami. Kothiyal, a retired Colonel, had resigned from AAP on May 18. He had contested the Assembly polls from the Gangotri Assembly constituency.

151.title: Drones used to trace Delhi engineer found dead in 500-ft gorge in Pune
151.article_body: Police used drones to locate a 24-year-old engineer from Delhi who went missing in a forest area near Lonavala last week. His body was found at a depth of 500 feet in a gorge near Duke's Nose Point. NDRF, INS Shivaji naval station in Lonavala, Pune Rural Police and some local groups were searching for him for last three days.

152.title: 200 bodies found in rubble of building in Ukraine's Mariupol
152.article_body: Ukrainian authorities on Tuesday said that workers digging through rubble have found 200 bodies in Mariupol. The bodies, which are in a state of decomposition, have been found in the basement of a collapsed apartment building, an adviser to Mariupol's mayor said. Recently, the Russian forces completed their takeover of the city, which has suffered extensive damage during the war.

153.title: 200+ challans issued for drunk driving in Noida, Greater Noida in a day
153.article_body: Police said 2,365 vehicles were checked and challans were issued to 215 people who were allegedly found driving in drunk condition in Noida, Central Noida and Greater Noida areas on Monday. "Senior police officers had also hit the ground to lead foot marches for inspection in...busy areas of district including markets...near shopping malls, metro stations...key roads and junctions," police added.

154.title: Housing prices rise by up to 11% across 8 cities in Jan-Mar: Report
154.article_body: A joint report by CREDAI, Colliers and Liases Foras said housing prices rose by up to 11% YoY across eight major cities between January and March 2022. Housing prices in Delhi-NCR witnessed the highest rise of 11% to ₹7,363/square feet, followed by Hyderabad with a 9% rise to ₹9,232/square feet. Ahmedabad saw an 8% rise to ₹5,721/square feet.

155.title: Pic of Aishwarya Rai's ₹1,500 modelling bill from 1992 surfaces
155.article_body: A picture of the bill Aishwarya Rai charged for appearing in a fashion catalogue in 1992 was shared by a Bollywood account on Reddit. The bill specifies that Aishwarya, who was 'aged about 18 years' at the time, 'agreed to work as a model' for a firm called Krupa Kreations. It carries her signature at the bottom.

156.title: Instagram unveils new logo, rolls out custom typeface 'Instagram Sans'
156.article_body: Instagram on Monday unveiled a new logo with a "vibrant gradient" and introduced a new typeface called 'Instagram Sans' as part of a "visual refresh". Instagram said the new gradient has been "reimagined using an innovative 3D modelling process". The new typeface is inspired by Instagram's logo as well as a combination of squares and circles, or "squircles", Instagram added.

157.title: SC stays NGT order imposing over ₹15 cr fine on Coca-Cola bottler
157.article_body: The Supreme Court has stayed a National Green Tribunal order imposing a penalty of over ₹15 crore on Coca-Cola bottling unit Moon Beverages. Earlier this year, the NGT had found Moon Beverages guilty of exploiting groundwater for bottling plants in UP's Greater Noida and Sahibabad. As per the petitioner, the extraction was being done in an indiscreet and arbitrary manner.

158.title: Finland, Sweden to send teams to Turkey to discuss NATO bids
158.article_body: Finland and Sweden will send delegations to Turkey to try to resolve Ankara's opposition to their applications for membership of NATO, Finnish Foreign Minister Pekka Haavisto said. President Recep Tayyip Erdogan had earlier said neither country should bother visiting to try to convince Turkey of their bids. Sweden and Finland cannot join the alliance without the support of all members.

159.title: Dayaben to return to 'Taarak...', not sure about actress: Producer
159.article_body: 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah' producer Asit Kumar Modi has stated that the character of Dayaben will be returning to the television show after four years. The character was portrayed by actress Disha Vakani. Asif added that Disha is now married and has a kid and it's uncertain if the character will be portrayed by her or a different actress.

160.title: Babar would've been a top IPL star, picked by MI for highest amount: Akhtar
160.article_body: Shoaib Akhtar said Pakistan captain Babar Azam would have been a top star in the IPL, adding MI would have picked him for the "highest" amount. Akhtar stated that Pakistan opener Mohammad Rizwan would have been signed by RCB because Virat Kohli needs a team man. "As an opener, Rizwan would have made a greater impact for RCB," he said.

161.title: Won't spare even our own leaders: Kejriwal as Mann sacks AAP minister
161.article_body: After Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann dismissed state minister Vijay Singla over corruption allegations, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said AAP "won't spare" even its own leaders if found involved in corruption. "No one knew about this corruption, neither the media nor Opposition. Had CM Mann wanted, he would've asked for a slice of it with a 'setting'," the AAP chief added.

162.title: The South Indian film industry has always existed: Abhay on North-South debate
162.article_body: Actor Abhay Deol commented on the ensuing North-South debate and said, "The South Indian film industry has always existed and has always had their audience." "Now, there's a bit of mish-mash happening because you realise, oh 'Baahubali looks great', or 'This actor looks interesting, let's take him in a different language movie' and vice-versa," he added.

163.title: We have set the bar very high for 'Salaar': Vijay Kiragandur
163.article_body: Vijay Kiragandur of Hombale Films said they've set the bar high for 'Salaar'. "On one hand, we have Prabhas, who's the hero of...(Baahubali 2) and on the other hand, we've Prashanth Neel and Hombale, who made the second-biggest film of India (KGF 2)," he added. "This is a deadly combination and it's going to be a big challenge," he said.

164.title: 5 time former Guj Cong MLA's son joins BJP along with supporters
164.article_body: Late Gujarat Congress leader Anil Joshiyara's son, Keval, joined the BJP along with around 1,300 supporters in Bhiloda, Arvalli on Tuesday. Anil, who passed away in March 2022 due to COVID-19, was elected five times as an MLA from the tribal region in North Gujarat. Notably, Gujarat BJP President CR Paatil was present to welcome Keval to the party.

165.title: Urge public to remain alert: CRPF DIG on Amarnath Yatra
165.article_body: Security arrangements have been made at the place where pilgrims will stay during the Amarnath Yatra, Rajendra Prasad, DIG CRPF, said. "I urge the public to remain alert and inform the security personnel if they see any anti-social element," Prasad added. "Additional deployment is being done. We've drawn outline-details of deployment already made in main sensitive areas," Prasad stated.

166.title: Daniel Vettori appointed assistant coach of Australian men's cricket team
166.article_body: Former New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori has been confirmed as one of the Australian men's team's new full-time assistant coaches. Vettori has been appointed to the permanent position following a stint with the team during the white-ball leg of the Pakistan tour. Andre Borovec has also been appointed one of the assistant coaches.

167.title: What will happen if rain washes out IPL 2022 playoffs?
167.article_body: Number of overs in IPL 2022 playoffs can be reduced to five per side at maximum in case of rain interruption. In case that isn't possible, a Super Over will be played to determine the winner. If Super Over is also not possible, team that finished highest on the points table will be declared the winner of that particular match.

168.title: Boat carrying tourists capsizes in Maharashtra, 2 dead
168.article_body:
A boat carrying nearly 20 tourists capsized in the Arabian Sea off the Malvan coast in Maharashtra's Sindhudurg district on Tuesday, killing two people. One more person is in critical condition. The deceased persons were from Pune and Akola, officials said, adding
that the tourists were returning after scuba-diving.

169.title: Fawad Khan gave me a tough time on 'Zindagi Gulzar Hai': Sheheryar
169.article_body: Pakistani actor Sheheryar Munawar revealed Fawad Khan gave him a tough time while shooting 'Zindagi Gulzar Hai'. The interviewer asked if Fawad bullied him. To this, Sheheryar said, "It was a different kind, not the bullying we see on television." "Fawad was tough on me...the fear of being there on set, it was...a difficult time for me," he added.

170.title: Russian offensive in Donbas biggest since World War II: Ukraine
170.article_body: The Russian offensive in the Donbas region of Ukraine is a "ruthless battle, the largest one on European soil since World War II", Ukraine's Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba said. Kuleba also urged Ukraine's allies to speed up the supply of weapons and ammunition to the country, especially multiple launch rocket systems (MLRS), long-range artillery, and armoured personnel carriers (APCs).

171.title: Hope Buttler retains orange cap but doesn't score in Qualifier 1: Tewatia
171.article_body: Praising Jos Buttler ahead of GT-RR Qualifier 1 match in IPL 2022, Buttler's ex-RR teammate and GT all-rounder Rahul Tewatia said he hopes the RR opener retains the orange cap but doesn't score against GT. "He is as calm off the field as he's aggressive with the bat," he added. Buttler has scored 629 runs in 14 matches so far.

172.title: 6 students test COVID-19 positive at Anna University in Tamil Nadu
172.article_body: Six students at the Anna University campus in Tamil Nadu's Guindy have tested positive for COVID-19. Health Secretary J Radhakrishnan said a cultural event had taken place at the university. When a woman who participated in the event had few symptoms, she got tested and was found to be positive for COVID-19.

173.title: I was surprised, suffered with him: Suarez on Messi's Barcelona exit
173.article_body: Sharing his opinion on Lionel Messi's exit from Barcelona after 21 years, former Barcelona striker Luis Suarez said, "I was surprised and...suffered with him because he was also surprised." "We had been on vacation a few days before and he said...[he'll renew on Thursday]. [Messi's wife] Antonela informed my wife on Thursday afternoon that he did not renew," added Suarez.

174.title: Boeing's Starliner to return to Earth on May 26, NASA to provide live telecast
174.article_body: Boeing's CST-100 Starliner spacecraft will complete the Orbital Flight Test-2 mission and depart from the International Space Station at 12.06 am IST on May 26 for a landing in the western United States. NASA will begin the live coverage of the event on May 24 on NASA Television, NASA App and the agency's website.

175.title: Ekta said 'You'll be next sex bomb on TV', I laughed: Urvashi on Komolika
