175.article_body: Talking about her famous character of Komolika, actress Urvashi Dholakia said Indian television producer Ekta Kapoor told her that she is going to become the next sex bomb of television industry. She added that she laughed at this. "I didn't have anything in mind back then...I was like 'I need to work...I have to fend, I have responsibilities'," she added.

176.title: SRK attends event in Delhi; does his signature open arms pose, pics surface
176.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan was in Delhi for a promotional event on Tuesday, where he greeted fans with his signature 'open arms pose'. The actor wore a black suit with a white shirt and completed the look with a pair of black sunglasses. The actor's manager took to Instagram to share pictures of Shah Rukh, and captioned them, "Delhi diaries."

177.title: Cong always trying to damage faith of Hindus: Hardik Patel
177.article_body: Hardik Patel, who has recently quit Congress, said that the Congress party works to hurt the sentiments of people and is always trying to damage the faith of the Hindu religion. His statement came after he alleged that a senior Gujarat Congress leader had said that dogs urinate on bricks being used for building the Ram temple in Ayodhya.

178.title: Gurugram Police arrests 2 sharpshooters, recovers ₹7 lakh
178.article_body: Two sharpshooters carrying a reward of ₹1 lakh each were arrested by the Gurugram Police recently. The police have also recovered a foreign-made pistol and ₹7 lakh from the two accused. The two accused, belonging to the Kaushal gang, had shot dead an auto driver in Gurugram's Feroz Gandhi Colony on February 22 last year, according to the police.

179.title: BESCOM provides WhatsApp numbers for consumers to lodge complaints
179.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company has provided WhatsApp helpline numbers for consumers to lodge complaints regarding power-related issues. This comes as the existing helpline number of BESCOM 1912 has been flooded with complaint calls by citizens. Karnataka Energy Minister V Sunil Kumar had instructed BESCOM to provide WhatsApp numbers to all eight districts of its jurisdiction.

180.title: Aditya Birla Fashion to sell 7.5% stake to GIC to raise ₹2,195 cr
180.article_body: Aditya Birla Fashion on Tuesday said its board has approved raising up to ₹2,195 crore by selling a minority stake of 7.5% to Singapore's GIC sovereign wealth fund. Investments will be raised by way of preferential issuance of equity and warrants to an affiliate of GIC. After the transaction, Aditya Birla Group will hold 51.9% stake in the company.

181.title: Officials to install banners welcoming Amarnath pilgrims: Kashmir official
181.article_body: The officials have been directed by Divisional Commissioner, Kashmir, Pandurang K Pole, to install banners welcoming Amarnath Yatra pilgrims in all panchayats, villages and municipal areas along the Yatra route. "Also share different samples of welcome banners...by May 27 for approval of Divisional Commissioner, Kashmir," the order issued by Pole stated.

182.title: Nikki, Aadhi Pinisetty host wedding reception in Chennai, pics surface
182.article_body: Nikki Galrani and Aadhi Pinisetty hosted a reception in Chennai, which was attended by many celebrities from the film industry including Radhika Sarathkumar, Naseer, Aishwarya Rajesh, Arnav Vijay and Ilaiyaraaja. The couple tied the knot on Thursday in the presence of their family and friends. The wedding was attended by actors Nani and Sundeep Kishan.

183.title: Chennai transforming into a 'city of killings': AIADMK leader
183.article_body: AIADMK leader Edappadi K Palaniswami on Tuesday alleged that Tamil Nadu's capital Chennai is transforming into a 'city of killings'. Chennai alone witnessed 18 murders in 20 days, Palaniswami said, adding that a question mark hangs over people's security. He further blamed CM MK Stalin, who holds the police portfolio, for 'not improving' law and order situation in the state.

184.title: OYO shelves plan to launch IPO in 2022: Report
184.article_body: Hospitality and travel-tech firm OYO is shelving plans to launch its IPO in 2022, Bloomberg reported. If OYO picks up the plan to launch the IPO before the year-end, the earliest possibility for the launch would be in 2023. PTI, however, reported on Tuesday that OYO plans to launch the IPO at a reduced valuation of $7-8 billion post-September.

185.title: Mini Defence Expo to be held in Kolkata for first time from July 6-9
185.article_body: On Tuesday, the Eastern Army Commander Lieutenant General RP Kalita announced that a Mini Defence Expo will be held for the first time in Kolkata from July 6-9 this year. "It (Mini Defence Expo) will give the MSMEs and start-ups in the defence sector a good opportunity to showcase their products," General Kalita said.

186.title: Undersea 'shark volcano' is erupting, says NASA; shares satellite pics
186.article_body: Satellite pictures shared by NASA have shown an eruption of the famous 'sharkcano' (shark volcano), which is a submarine (underwater) volcano in the Solomon Islands. Two species of sharks have been found living in the acidic waters of the submerged crater. The pictures have shown "a plume of discoloured water being emitted" from the Kavachi Volcano, NASA said.

187.title: When we studied engineering there was no girl in our class, it seemed so bad: Bihar CM
187.article_body: While inaugurating a hostel in Magadh Mahila College, Patna, Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday said, "When we studied in engineering college, there was no girl in our class...it seemed so bad." He added, "Whenever any woman came, students used to gather in large numbers to see her. Now see how many girls are studying in engineering and medical colleges."

188.title: People kept asking me 'Why aren't you doing films like Lust Stories': Sanjay
188.article_body: Actor Sanjay Kapoor said he is definitely getting better offers and opportunities now. "You have to be patient. For example, you start getting better offers after you prove yourself with one project. For me, it was 'Lust Stories'," he added. "People kept on asking me 'Why aren't you doing films like that?'," Sanjay said.

189.title: Mark Ruffalo joins Pattinson in 'Parasite' director Bong's next sci-fi film
189.article_body: Actors Mark Ruffalo, Toni Collette and Naomi Ackie have joined the cast of Bong Joon Ho's upcoming directorial set at Warner Bros. The sci-fi feature, also starring Robert Pattinson, is based on the novel Mickey7, written by Edward Ashton. Bong's 2019 film 'Parasite' won multiple awards at the 92nd Academy Awards, including Best Picture.

190.title: Suhana celebrates her 22nd b'day with Khushi Kapoor on 'The Archies' sets
190.article_body: Actor Shah Rukh Khan's daughter Suhana Khan on Tuesday shared a few pictures from her 22nd birthday celebration on the sets of her debut film, 'The Archies'. In one photo, Suhana can be seen posing alongside Khushi Kapoor. For her birthday, she donned an orange bodycon dress and also shared pictures of the bouquets she received on her special day.

191.title: BJP denies ticket to BS Yediyurappa's son for upcoming MLC polls
191.article_body: The BJP announced its candidates for the upcoming Karnataka MLC elections in which the party denied ticket to BJP leader BS Yediyurappa's son, Vijayendra Yeddyurappa, who is the present State Vice President of the party. The Karnataka BJP core committee had earlier recommended over a dozen names as probable candidates, including Vijayendra, for the MLC polls, reports said.

192.title: Indian Army rescues 12 people from overturned mini-bus in Leh
192.article_body: The Indian Army rescued 12 passengers, including five children trapped inside an overturned mini-bus in Leh and provided necessary medical assistance, a Defence spokesperson said. The vehicle had overturned after it collided with another mini-bus on the Shyok-Durbuk road on Monday. A team of 12 soldiers returning from Durbuk witnessed the accident and swung into action to rescue the civilians.

193.title: RJ Umar from Kashmir receives Immunisation Champion award by UNICEF
193.article_body: A Radio Jockey from south Kashmir, Umar Nisar, also known as RJ Umar, has been awarded the '01 Best Content Award' and the Immunisation Champion award by UNICEF at the annual Radio4Child 2022 Awards in Mumbai. The Radio4Child felicitated radio professionals from All India Radio and private FM channels across India for their work during COVID-19 and for routine vaccination.

194.title: Vagheri hill to be declared eco-sensitive area: Goa Forest Minister
194.article_body: A file has been moved to declare Goa's Vagheri hill as an eco-sensitive area, state Forest Minister Vishwajit Rane said. He also shared the hill's pictures, adding that they show how it has been "cleared from the top". He further said that he will instruct his department to use satellite and Google imagery to monitor eco-sensitive areas every 15 days.

195.title: Cyberabad Police bust gang manufacturing fake phenyl
195.article_body: Cyberabad Police on Monday took to Twitter to inform that the police have busted a gang, which was illegally manufacturing fake phenyl, acid chemicals and floor cleaning chemicals. According to the police, the gang was busted after they received credible information about the racket. Police have further arrested the gang members for carrying out illegal activities without permission .

196.title: Aus-India ties have never been closer: PM Albanese at Quad summit
196.article_body: On the sidelines of Quad summit in Tokyo, newly-elected Australian PM Anthony Albanese praised his country's ties with India, claiming that they have "never been closer". "Warmly welcomed my meeting with [PM Narendra Modi] for an engaging discussion on Australia and India’s full strategic and economic agenda, including on clean energy technology," he tweeted. PMO described the talks as "fruitful".

197.title: The way Akshay spoke about being rejected for 'Jo Jeeta...' was derogatory: Maker
197.article_body: Director Mansoor Khan has reacted to Akshay Kumar's old interview wherein he had revealed that he was rejected during the audition for 'Jo Jeeta Wohi Sikandar'. "Screen test diya maine...And they didn't like it. [Apparently], I was crap," Akshay had said. Mansoor said, "The way he has spoken about being rejected...is very derogatory and condescending...I never said he was crap."

198.title: Depp's behaviour that of intimate partner violence: Psychiatrist
198.article_body: Psychiatrist Dr David Spiegel testified against Johnny Depp on Monday in his defamation trial against ex-wife Amber Heard over her 2018 op-ed claiming to survive domestic abuse. "Depp has behaviours that are consistent with someone that both has substance use disorder as well as behaviours of someone who is a perpetrator of intimate partner violence," Spiegel stated.

199.title: Russia is not chasing deadlines in Ukraine: Top security official
199.article_body: Nikolai Patrushev, the Secretary of the Russian Security Council, said that Russia "isn't chasing deadlines" in Ukraine. "All the goals set by the President [Vladimir Putin] will be fulfilled. It cannot be otherwise, because truth, including historical truth, is on our side," he added. Patrushev also said that Ukraine was being used by the West to contain Russia.

200.title: GT head coach Ashish Nehra jokingly kicks RR's Chahal, GT share pic
200.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) took to Twitter to share a picture of their head coach Ashish Nehra jokingly kicking Rajasthan Royals (RR) leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal. "Absolutely kicked to have Yuzi and Nehraji bless us with this moment," GT captioned the post. GT will face RR in IPL 2022's Qualifier 1 tonight at Eden Gardens in Kolkata.

201.title: Russia's biggest mobile operator starts selling used phones amid inflation
201.article_body: Russia’s biggest mobile operator MTS has started selling discounted and used smartphones amid inflation and Western brands suspending shipments. While Apple has paused all product sales in Russia due to the Ukraine war, sales of Chinese smartphone brands doubled in the first two weeks of March in Russia. "This is a good opportunity for our company," said an MTS official.

202.title: Delhivery shares close 10% higher on first day of trading, m-cap hits ₹38,851 cr
202.article_body: Shares of logistics startup Delhivery closed 10.11% higher on their first day of trading on Tuesday. The stock ended at ₹536.25 on the NSE, after listing at a premium of 1.7% over an issue price of ₹487 per share. The Gurugram-based startup, which had raised ₹5,235 crore through its IPO, held a market capitalisation of ₹38,851 crore on Tuesday's close.

203.title: Russian envoy to UN resigns over 'bloody, witless' Ukraine war
203.article_body: A Russian envoy to the UN in Switzerland, Boris Bondarev, said he resigned from his post over the Ukraine war. He said he raised concerns about the Russian invasion with senior embassy staff but was told "to keep my mouth shut in order to avoid ramifications". He said he cannot share in "this bloody, witless and absolutely needless ignominy".

204.title: Potable water supply in NDMC area reduced by 60%: Civic body member
204.article_body: New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) Member Kuljeet Singh Chahal has written to Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal claiming that the drinking water supply to NDMC area has been reduced by up to 60%. Chahal said that in the last 10 days, NDMC has been supplied 60-70 million litres per day (MLD) compared to the average of 125 MLD it usually receives.

205.title: Would have scored 10,000-plus Test runs had I not been dropped in 2007, it hurt: Sehwag
205.article_body: Recalling getting dropped from India's Test side in 2007, Virender Sehwag said that on realising that he was not part of the side, it hurt him. "I would have ended with 10,000+ Test runs had I not been dropped for that period," Sehwag added. Sehwag played just one Test in 2007 before making a comeback in 2008.

206.title: AAP has zero-tolerance against corruption: Punjab CM after sacking min
206.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, who sacked Health Minister Dr Vijay Singla from the state cabinet over corruption charges, said that his party has zero-tolerance policy against corruption. "I took [the matter] very seriously. Nobody knew about it, had I wanted it, I could have brushed it under the carpet. But I would have broken the trust of people," Mann said.

207.title: In a bid to get refund of ₹578 from IRCTC, Mumbai man loses ₹1.78 lakh
207.article_body: A man lost ₹1.78 lakh to a cyber fraudster while he was trying to get a refund of ₹578 from Indian Railway Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC). An FIR was registered at Tardeo police station. Reports said that the man searched for IRCTC's helpline number online and got connected to cyber fraudster. He extorted man's bank details and cheated him.

208.title: At 25, we predicted how our journey should end: Haasan on Rajinikanth
208.article_body: Discussing his 40-year friendship with actor Rajinikanth, actor Kamal Haasan said, "Rajini and I are competitors and friends at the same time. When we both were 25, we predicted how this journey of ours should end." "We are living...with the respect that it deserves," added Haasan. "You keep switching sides and shouting at each other. Not us," he stated.

209.title: Weibo bans Trip.com co-founder who questioned China's COVID-19 strategy
209.article_body: Chinese social media platform Weibo has banned Trip.com Co-founder James Liang who had questioned China's zero-COVID strategy, accusing him of violating laws. Liang had authored an article published on a think tank's WeChat account in which he argued that overly cautious epidemic prevention policies could inflict bigger pain on the economy. Weibo did not specify which laws Liang had broken.

210.title: New dinosaur species that lived 72 mn years ago discovered in Japan
210.article_body: Researchers have identified a new species and genus of dinosaurs from fossils unearthed in Japan's Hokkaido. Named Paralitherizinosaurus japonicus, these (mostly) plant-eating dinosaurs lived about 72 million years ago. They belonged to a family of small to large theropod dinosaurs called Therizinosauridae. Belonging to a new taxon, these dinosaurs had distinct characteristics in limbs and claws.

211.title: Over 3,000 bike riders booked for using banned multi-toned horns in Hyd
211.article_body: Hyderabad Traffic Police has registered cases against over 3,000 bike riders for using banned multi-toned horns and air horns. It has also imposed a fine of ₹1,000 on them. Joint Commissioner of Police (Traffic) AV Ranganath said charge sheets would be filed in the court against owners of such vehicles from June onwards and the violators will also face prosecution.

212.title: 5-yr-old girl sexually assaulted at Mumbai school; 51-yr-old peon held
212.article_body: A 51-year-old peon in a school was arrested for allegedly sexually assaulting a five-year-old girl in Mumbai's Mulund, police said. The incident took place when the victim, who lived in the locality, arrived to play at the school ground on Monday, police added. He lured her with chocolate, took her to a room and allegedly sexually assaulted her, police stated.

213.title: 2 IIMs make it to world's top 50 colleges for executive education in FT ranking
213.article_body: Indian Institute of Management (IIM) Ahmedabad and IIM Bangalore have made it among the top 50 colleges for executive education, occupying the 39th and 45th places in Financial Times (FT) latest ranking. The executive education custom FT ranking also featured the Indian School of Business, Hyderabad (38th rank), apart from IIM Ahmedabad (50) and IIM Bangalore (43).

214.title: Feeling of India call up yet to set in: Arshdeep Singh
214.article_body: Punjab Kings pacer Arshdeep Singh has said that the feeling of getting selected in India's T20I squad for the series against South Africa is yet to set in. "Really happy that I've been selected...Came to know about it in the team bus," Arshdeep said. "I want to keep performing to the best of my ability in the future," he added.

215.title: Depp's reaction as psychiatrist says 'Isn't Marlon Brando dead?' viral
215.article_body: Psychiatrist Dr David Spiegel, while testifying in trial, said he was aware Johnny Depp used an earpiece for his lines while filming. Depp's lawyer then asked David if he knew Marlon Brando also used an earpiece. To this, David replied, "Isn't he dead?" Depp covered his face with his hand after David's statement. Depp's reaction went viral on social media.

216.title: Agent leaks 'Aquaman 2' spoilers during Depp-Heard testimony
216.article_body: Agent Kathryn Arnold, while testifying in the ongoing defamation trial filed by Johnny Depp against ex-wife Amber Heard, revealed plot points of 'Aquaman 2'. Arnold said that Heard's character Mera was "injured somehow or it had something to do with a baby". She further said that Mera "ends up in the hospital early in...movie and doesn't...come out until the end".

217.title: Arrangements made to protect wild animals during floods: Assam Minister
217.article_body: The Assam Forest Department has made all preventive arrangements to protect wild animals during floods, said state Forest Minister Parimal Suklabaidya. "We'll introduce a time card for all vehicles to restrict vehicular speed on roads...passing through national parks and wildlife sanctuaries," the minister said. Rescue teams have also been formed for Kaziranga National Park, he added.

218.title: We're focusing on developing ties with China: Russia Foreign Min
218.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergey Lavrov said the country would consider offers from the West to re-establish ties and determine "whether we'll need it or not", but for now will focus on developing relations with China. Russia will count on "only ourselves and on countries which have proved themselves reliable and do not 'dance to some other piper's music'", he added.

219.title: Deity at Qutub Minar survived without worship for 800 years, let that continue: Court
219.article_body: While hearing a petitioner seeking to worship Hindu deities within Qutub Minar complex, a Delhi court observed, "The deity has survived for 800 years without any worship. Let them survive like that." The Archaeological Survey of India maintained that even though images of Hindu and Jain deities were used in Qutub Minar complex's construction, revival of worship can't be allowed.

220.title: SC agrees to hear Azam's plea on Jauhar University demolition threat
220.article_body: The Supreme Court on Tuesday agreed to hear a plea filed by SP leader Azam Khan this week, against the impending threat of demolition of Mohammad Ali Jauhar University, as part of the condition of his bail. A senior advocate, appearing for Khan, mentioned the matter for urgent hearing before a bench of Justices DY Chandrachud and Bela M Trivedi.

221.title: Defending champion Djokovic enters 2nd round at French Open
221.article_body: Defending champion Novak Djokovic defeated Japan's Yoshihito Nishioka 6-3, 6-1, 6-0 in the first round of men's singles at the French Open on Monday. Earlier, 13-time champion Rafael Nadal beat Australia's Jordan Thompson 6-2, 6-2, 6-2. In the women's singles, world number one Iga Swiatek posted a 6-2, 6-0 victory over Ukrainian Lesia Tsurenko in 54 minutes.

222.title: Nothing Hindu about wanting to murder, beat up people: Rahul
222.article_body: While being questioned about how Congress would fight 'Hindu nationalism', party leader Rahul Gandhi said that there is "nothing" Hindu and nationalist about the term, reported PTI. He added that he's studied Hinduism in "enough detail" and there's "absolutely nothing Hindu about wanting to murder people and beat people up". Rahul made the remarks at Cambridge University's Corpus Christi College.

223.title: 11-yr-old's rare birth cataract treated under govt scheme in Pune
223.article_body: An 11-year-old girl in Pune suffering from a rare cataract defect since birth was treated free of cost under a government scheme at district civil hospital. The girl, Snehal Shivram Warye, was previously unable to read and write due to problems with her vision, her school teacher said. Snehal, who was also given free post-operative care, can now see better.

224.title: Paresh, Revathi to star in film adaptation of Ray's Golpo Bolo Tarini Khuro
224.article_body: Satyajit Ray's short story 'Golpo Bolo Tarini Khuro' is being adapted into a film. Titled 'The Storyteller', the film will star Paresh Rawal, Adil Hussain, Revathi and Tannishtha Chatterjee. Ananth Narayan Mahadevan, who will direct 'The Storyteller', said that the team is "happy and honoured" to introduce the master storyteller to the younger generation with the upcoming film.

225.title: Pak govt says will hold polls in August 2023, not before: Report
225.article_body: The Pakistani government led by PM Shehbaz Sharif has rejected his predecessor Imran Khan's demand to hold elections early, according to a report quoting sources. The ruling PML-N reportedly said the elections would be held in August 2023, after the completion of the ongoing term. Notably, Khan is planning a protest march to Islamabad seeking dissolution of the National Assembly.

226.title: FB selfie helps B'luru police to arrest murder accused after 5 yrs
226.article_body: Bengaluru City Police have arrested a 35-year-old murder accused, Madhusoodhan alias Madhu, who was on the run for five years. According to police, Madhu's friend had recently posted a selfie of them on Facebook, which led to his arrest. Madhu and his associates allegedly killed a retired bank manager to rob a diamond necklace worth crores in 2014.

227.title: Brought tears: Kejriwal after Mann dismisses Punjab Health Minister
227.article_body: After Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann dismissed state Health Minister Vijay Singla following corruption charges against him, Delhi CM and AAP founder Arvind Kejriwal tweeted, "Proud of you Bhagwant. Your action has brought tears to my eyes." Singla was demanding a 1% commission from officials for contracts, Punjab CM's Office said. Singla was later arrested by the state's Anti-Corruption Branch.

228.title: Pawan Kalyan, ex-wife attend son Akira's high school graduation, share post
228.article_body: Actor Pawan Kalyan and his ex-wife Renu Desai attended their 18-year-old son Akira Nandan’s high school graduation ceremony. On Monday, Renu and Pawan shared a family photo featuring  Akira. Alongside the post, Renu wrote, "An era ends and an era begins. Proud parents of an amazing boy on his graduation day...I have told Akira that his true journey begins now."

229.title: Had pre-jitters; Cannes is big, you pray you don't fall, step on dress: Nargis
229.article_body: Actress Nargis Fakhri said that she had jitters before walking the red carpet at Cannes. "I was a little stressed about walking the red carpet as walking for Cannes is a big thing. You want everything to work out. You are praying that you don't fall or step on your dress or that any mishaps happen," she added.

230.title: Too bad, I'm never letting you go: Farah shares pic with Shirish on his b'day
230.article_body: Farah Khan Kunder took to Instagram on Tuesday to wish her filmmaker-husband Shirish Kunder on his 49th birthday. Sharing a few pictures, she wrote, "Too bad, I'm never letting you go...Happy birthday Shirish (pics 2&3 will explain why)." The first picture features Farah and Shirish, while the second and third pictures feature Shirish with his kids, Czar, Diva and Anya.

231.title: Exams of non-agriculture universities in Maha to be held offline: Minister
231.article_body: The examinations of non-agriculture universities in Maharashtra will be held offline, said state Higher and Technical Education Minister Uday Samant on Tuesday. "If we keep conducting the exams online, it would raise a question mark on whether the industry would accept such students," Samant said, adding that the decision has been taken by vice-chancellors of 13 non-agricultural universities.

232.title: Bengaluru civic body begins training doctors on treating monkeypox
232.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has started imparting training to doctors on treating monkeypox. As per reports, healthcare workers are being trained to look for symptoms of the viral disease. Besides this, the daily testing for COVID-19 will be scaled up from 11,000 to 15,000, according to BBMP Special Commissioner (Administration) S Rangappa.

233.title: UP teacher submits fake graduation marksheet to get job, booked
233.article_body: A teacher of an inter-college in UP’s Muzaffarnagar has been booked for allegedly submitting a fake document in order to get a job, police said. He was posted as an assistant teacher at Arvind Inter College in Muzaffarnagar district, police added. His graduation marksheet was found to be fake, following which an FIR was lodged on Monday.

234.title: Kangana trolled over failure of 'Dhaakad', Richa says 'People are expressing dissent'
234.article_body: Richa Chadha said those trolling Kangana Ranaut on the failure of 'Dhaakad' are "expressing dissent in whatever way they can". She was replying to tweets by Tehseen Poonawalla, wherein he criticised trolls "celebrating" its failure. However, Richa also wrote that it's "morally wrong because thousands of people work on a film", while adding, "But also, it happens. And to everyone."

235.title: India's 1st  self-driving cars startup Minus Zero raises $1.7 million in funding
235.article_body: India's first startup building affordable fully self-driving cars, Minus Zero, has raised $1.7 million in a seed round led by Chiratae Ventures with participation from JITO Angel Network and senior executives from American chipmaker NVIDIA and US-based ride-hailing service Lyft. The startup was founded by Gagandeep Reehal and Gursimran Kalra in 2021 while they were still students.

236.title: Sri Lanka seeks $500 million loan from India for purchase of petroleum products
236.article_body: Sri Lanka is seeking a $500-million loan from the Export-Import Bank of India (India Exim Bank) to purchase petroleum products amid severe economic crisis. Sri Lanka on Tuesday raised petrol and diesel prices by record 24.3% and 38.4%, respectively. On Monday, India delivered around 40,000 metric tonnes of petrol to Sri Lanka, days after supplying 40,000 metric tonnes of diesel.

237.title: Anything related to sex still remains to be a taboo in society: Ram Gopal Varma
237.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma said he was disappointed when some theatres refused to screen his lesbian film 'Khatra'. He added, "Anything related to sex still remains to be a taboo [in society]." "Even today, despite the Supreme Court repealing section 377, nearly four and a half years back, I don't think people are willing to talk about it," Varma said.

238.title: Playing in India, where my parents were born, is great opportunity: Alana King
238.article_body: Australian spinner Alana King, who is currently playing for Supernovas in the Women's T20 Challenge said playing in India is a "great opportunity" for her. "To play in a country where my parents were born and raised is absolutely a great opportunity for me. I could not say no to this," said King after winning against the Trailblazers on Monday.

239.title: Meta's Zuckerberg sued over Cambridge Analytica privacy breach
239.article_body: Meta's billionaire CEO Mark Zuckerberg has been sued by the District of Columbia over the Cambridge Analytica scandal, a privacy breach of millions of Facebook users' personal data. The lawsuit seeks to hold Zuckerberg personally liable for the breach, maintaining that he directly participated in important company decisions and that he was aware of potential dangers of sharing users' data.

240.title: Pune youth arrested over contact with terror operatives in J&K
240.article_body: Pune unit of the Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) on Tuesday arrested a man, in his early 20s, from the Dapodi area for his alleged contact with terror operatives from Jammu and Kashmir. The accused, identified as Junaid Mohammed, was connected with them through phone messenger groups, officers said. He had also received ₹10,000 for terror-related activities from them, officers added.

241.title: Virtue of subsidy only if it's swift & for short run: Piyush Goyal
241.article_body: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal, during a panel at the World Economic Forum in Davos, said the "virtue of subsidy is only when it's swift and in the short run". "Our approach isn't going to be driven by subsidies...It's going to be...focused on structural reform and ease of doing business," he stated while urging Indian businesses to be "more proactive".

242.title: My mother once cried seeing my bruised face, said no one would marry me: Boxer Nikhat
242.article_body: World champion boxer Nikhat Zareen has revealed that her mother started shivering and crying after seeing her bruised face following her first sparring session. Nikhat added that her mother then told her that no one would marry her. "I replied, 'Don’t worry, once I make a name for myself, grooms will queue up at the doorstep'," Nikhat stated.

243.title: 'If you fall asleep, it's ok', says Biden jokingly to new Australia PM at Quad meet
243.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Tuesday welcomed newly-elected Australia PM Anthony Albanese to his first Quad meeting and praised him for making the long journey to Japan, right after being sworn in. Biden told Albanese, "You were sworn in and got on a plane...if you fall asleep while you're here, it's okay, because I don't know how you're doing it."

244.title: Mumbai Police shares 'Panchayat 2' meme asking people to avoid triple ride
244.article_body: The Mumbai Traffic Police shared a meme on its Twitter handle using 'Panchayat' season 2 dialogue asking people to avoid riding triple seat. In its post, the Mumbai Police shared the reaction of a 'Responsible Citizen' when their friends ask them to go for a ride triple seat and quoted the dialogue, "Ye sab mein comfortable nahi hun mai."

245.title: I kill criminals, not children & elders like Putin: Philippine Prez
245.article_body: Outgoing Philippine President Rodrigo Duterte criticised Russian President Vladimir Putin over the deaths of civilians in Ukraine. "Many say that Putin and I are both killers...But I kill criminals, I don't kill children and...elderly," Duterte said. This is the first time that Duterte, who calls Putin an idol and a friend, voiced his rebuke over Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

246.title: TRAI's KYC-based caller ID plan won't be a competitor: Truecaller
246.article_body: Truecaller CEO Alan Mamedi in response to the Telecom Regulatory Authority of India (TRAI) planning to develop a KYC-based caller ID system said, "We do not see that this would be a competitive service comparable to the full range of services and functionality that Truecaller offers." The proposed service could be a "driving catalyst" for the company's growth, he added.

247.title: Goods worth lakhs of rupees destroyed after fire at Noida building
247.article_body: A massive fire broke out at a commercial building in Noida on Monday, destroying goods worth several lakhs of rupees, police said. Over 10 shops in the complex caught fire, which took around three hours to be doused, said Arun Kumar Singh, Chief Fire Officer of Gautam Buddha Nagar district. However, no casualties have been reported in the incident.

248.title: Ghaziabad civic body seeks ₹491 cr in pending funds from state govt
248.article_body: Ghaziabad Municipal Corporation is seeking ₹491 crore in pending funds from the state government as it seeks to carry out developmental work. Officials said that dues are pending on account of infrastructure development funds, which the civic body earns when residents take up sale deeds and pay stamp duties. The civic body is in dire need of funds, councillors said.

249.title: Heritage block at Hyd's Osmania Hospital won't be demolished: Owaisi
249.article_body: The century-old Osmania General Hospital's heritage block will be protected by the Telangana government while building new infrastructure. Hyderabad MP Asaduddin Owaisi said, "The hospital's heritage building won't be demolished but restored." He added that a new building will also be constructed while not obstructing the view of the heritage building and it is likely to cost nearly ₹560 crore.

250.title: Mental health report must before giving death sentence: Supreme Court
250.article_body: Supreme Court has ruled that all courts will now be required to call for an accused's mental health report and monitor their behaviour in jail before giving a death sentence. This will establish the person's frame of mind at the time of the crime, it added. SC was hearing an appeal made by three death row convicts from Madhya Pradesh.

251.title: Private tutor arrested from UP for kidnapping Thane girl student
251.article_body: A 35-year-old private tutor has been arrested from his residence in Uttar Pradesh for abducting his 13-year-old girl student from Thane. The accused was traced using Global Positioning System (GPS) 20 days after the girl went missing. The accused told police that he had kidnapped the girl by seducing her and convincing her that he loved her.

252.title: US oil price drops below $110 mark on global recession fears
252.article_body: US oil price fell below the $110 mark on Tuesday amid fears of a possible global recession and China's COVID-19 curbs affecting supply. While US West Texas Intermediate (WTI) fell 72 cents to $109.57/barrel, Brent crude fell 56 cents to $112.86/barrel. Price of Brent crude earlier hit $139/barrel in March this year, its highest since 2008.

253.title: 24-year-old missing Delhi engineer found dead in Lonavala forest
253.article_body: Pune police said on Tuesday that body of 24-year-old Delhi engineer, Farhan Serajuddin, who went missing in Lonavala forest near Pune on May 20, has been traced. Authorities, including NDRF, were coordinating operations to retrieve his body. Farhan, who had gone to Lonavala for trekking, had contacted his family to inform them that he lost his way before becoming untraceable.

254.title: Nawazuddin gets Excellence in Cinema Award at French Riviera fest
254.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui received the Excellence in Cinema Award at the French Riviera Film Festival. He received the honour from two-time Emmy award-winning actor Vincent De Paul. Sharing pictures on social media, Nawazuddin wrote, "Receiving the [award] made the wonderful evening...more special. Memorable time spent with the amazing Cinema Artists from across the Globe was a beautiful feeling."

255.title: No verdict on Gyanvapi Mosque case today, Muslim petitioners to be heard on May 26
255.article_body: The Varanasi district court, hearing the arguments on a civil suit on the Gyanvapi mosque-Kashi Viswanath temple complex dispute, on Tuesday said it will hear the Muslim side that has sought to reject Hindus' civil suit seeking claim on the mosque. The next hearing is scheduled for May 26 (Thursday). The court did not give any verdict on Tuesday.

256.title: Didn't like 'Dil...' song, asked director 'How will one dance on this': Farah
256.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Farah Khan said that she did not like the title track of 'Dil Bechara'. "I asked Mukesh [director], 'How will one dance on this?'. He reasoned, 'No, everyone has liked this song'...I was like, 'Let me do it in one shot. So in just one day, we'll complete the song shoot and I'll be free'," she added.

257.title: Tom Cruise 9 years older than me but looks younger: Jon Hamm
257.article_body: Actor Jon Hamm said that his 'Top Gun: Maverick' co-star Tom Cruise looks younger than him, adding that he doesn't know how that works. Tom, who is 59-years-old, is nine years older than Jon. Jon added that he was 15 when he first saw the film's prequel 'Top Gun', adding that he left the "heavy lifting" to the younger generation.

258.title: Agent says Heard kept 'Aquaman 2' role due to Jason Momoa: Report
258.article_body: Agent Kathryn Arnold testified in the ongoing defamation trial against Amber Heard filed by Johnny Depp. She stated Heard kept her "radically reduced" 'Aquaman 2' role because co-star Jason Momoa and director James Wan were "adamant she was in the film", reported Daily Mail. Kathryn reportedly said Momoa renegotiated his fee to $15 million but Heard was paid $2 million.

259.title: Rainfall, thundersquall predicted in several states; IMD releases list
259.article_body: IMD has predicted rainfall over J&K, Himachal Pradesh, Uttarakhand, Punjab, Haryana, UP, Rajasthan and MP today and tomorrow. It also predicted heavy rainfall over Odisha today and over Assam and Meghalaya on May 27 and 28 and widespread rain over Kerala and Puducherry for next five days. Thundersquall is predicted over Uttarakhand, Jharkhand, West Bengal and Odisha today.

260.title: OYO planning to launch $7-8 billion IPO after September: Report
260.article_body: OYO is planning to launch its IPO after September and has written to SEBI, seeking to file updated and restated consolidated financial information, PTI reported. The firm, which had earlier planned to raise $11 billion, is now reportedly prepared to settle for a lower valuation of $7-8 billion. OYO had last raised $5 million from Microsoft in August 2021.

261.title: Overcharged for water consumption by landlord, Nagpur couple dies by suicide
261.article_body: A couple allegedly died by suicide in Nagpur after being reportedly overcharged for water consumption by their landlord, police said on Monday.  The 45-year-old deceased who worked as a used vehicle dealer and his 40-year-old wife were the residents of Gauri Nagar in the Kalamna area of the city. Further investigation into the matter is underway, police said.

262.title: 4 dead, 5 injured as bus collides with truck in Rajasthan's Kota
262.article_body: A bus collided with a truck in Rajasthan's Kota leaving four passengers of the bus dead while five got injured. The deceased were identified as Virendra, Narayan, Jitendra Singh and Jitu. The driver of the bus, which had around 50 passengers, lost control after he stuck his neck out of the window to spit tobacco, police said.

263.title: Telangana Cong MLA criticises TRS on latter's RS candidate choice
263.article_body: Telangana Congress Working President Jagga Reddy has criticised the TRS government for reportedly nominating industrialist Bandi Parthasaradhi Reddy to the Rajya Sabha. "How can a person who committed a major scam is given a Rajya Sabha seat," asked Jagga. The Congress MLA further accused Parthasaradhi of indulging in the alleged Remdesivir medicine scam during the pandemic in the state.

264.title: Depp's ex-girlfriend Kate Moss to testify after Amber's 'stairs' remark: Report
264.article_body: Johnny Depp's ex-girlfriend Kate Moss will reportedly be testifying in the actor's defamation trial against his ex-wife Amber Heard. This comes after Amber had mentioned Moss being allegedly pushed down the stairs by Depp during her testimony. As per People magazine, Moss will testify in court via video link on Wednesday.  Moss and Depp dated in the 1990s.

265.title: If 2 co-stars go for coffee, it's reported they were 'spotted' together: Kartik
265.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan said if two actors who are working together go out for coffee, it will be reported that they were "spotted" together. "People will begin to talk...Shall I stop going out? Or shall I look for secret spots? What if two people are meeting...just as friends? If four people go out...they'll publish photos of just two," he added.

266.title: Delhi to install AEDs in public places to prevent cardiac arrest deaths
266.article_body: Delhi government is planning to install automated external defibrillators (AEDs) in public places to ensure quick medical attention to people experiencing sudden cardiac arrests. AED is a medical device designed to analyse the heart rhythm and restore it to normal via controlled electric shocks. Officials said a mapping exercise would begin to identify possible locations in Delhi to install AEDs.

267.title: Hope UN rights chief's Xinjiang visit will clarify misinformation: China
267.article_body: Ahead of UN High Commissioner for Human Rights chief's visit to Xinjiang region, China's Foreign Minister Wang Yi said he hoped that Michelle Bachelet's visit would help "clarify misinformation". Beijing has been accused of unlawful treatment and forced labour of Uighurs and other Muslim minorities in Xinjiang. She's expected to visit Xinjiang's Urumqi and Kashgar cities on Tuesday and Wednesday.

268.title: Johnny Depp's severed finger story has flaws, claims hand surgeon
268.article_body: A hand surgeon testified Johnny Depp couldn't have lost his finger tip the way he said it happened. Surgeon Richard Moore, called by Amber Heard's team, said Depp described his palm was down on a bar when it was struck by bottle. Moore, who didn't treat Depp, said Depp's description is unlikely, in large part because his fingernail remained intact.

269.title: Putin survived assassination attempt 2 months ago: Ukraine spy chief
269.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin was attacked in an attempt to be killed around two months ago, shortly after the start of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, the Chief of Defence Intelligence of Ukraine has said. The attempt on Putin's life was made in the Caucasus region, Kyrylo Budanov said. He called the attempt "absolutely unsuccessful".

270.title: Rahul Dravid took the call to not include Dhawan in India's T20I squad: Reports
270.article_body: India head coach Rahul Dravid took the call to not include Shikhar Dhawan in T20I squad for the series against South Africa, reports stated quoting a senior BCCI official. "In T20Is, you've to give chances to youngsters who have been doing well. We all agreed [with Rahul's decision]. Shikhar was informed by Rahul before the team announcement," the official stated.

271.title: Klarna doesn't exist in a bubble: CEO after firing 10% of startup's workforce
271.article_body: Klarna CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski told employees the Swedish fintech startup "doesn't exist in a bubble" as he announced plans to fire about 10% of its global workforce. "When we set our business plans for 2022...it was a very different world," he wrote. "Since then, we've seen a tragic...war in Ukraine unfold...increase in inflation, a highly volatile stock market," Siemiatkowski added.

272.title: India looking to limit sugar exports, say reports; sugar companies' shares plunge
272.article_body: Shares of sugar companies plunged on Tuesday after reports said that Indian government is looking to limit sugar exports for the first time in six years to prevent a surge in domestic prices. Reuters reported the government could cap this season's exports at 10 million tonnes. India is the world's biggest sugar producer and the second biggest exporter behind Brazil.

273.title: Sonia Gandhi forms new groups, task force for 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'
273.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi has formed a 'Political Affairs Group' that will be presided by her, a 'Task Force-2024' and a 'Central Planning Group' for the coordination of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. "Each member of the task force shall be assigned specific tasks related to organisation, communications and media, outreach, finance and election management," said the party.

274.title: 1,000 kg meat bought for wedding biryani seized due to bad quality in TN
274.article_body: The Food Safety Department in Tamil Nadu has seized 800 kg of spoiled mutton and 200 kg of chicken bought by a restaurant to prepare biryani for a wedding party in Tiruvarur. The caterers experienced a foul smell and the meat didn't cook properly. A food safety officer said the samples will be sent to a laboratory for testing.

275.title: Police to penalise people for storing bricks on rooftops in Bihar's Champaran
275.article_body: In order to prevent incidents of stone pelting, the West Champaran police in Bihar has decided to penalise people for storing bricks or stones on the rooftop of their houses. "We'll conduct aerial survey of the district. If bricks or stones are found on a rooftop...notice will immediately be served to...owner of the house seeking explanation," said SHO Rakesh Bhaskar.

276.title: Akshay Kumar recovers from COVID-19, resumes 'Prithviraj' promotions
276.article_body: Akshay Kumar, who was diagnosed with COVID-19 recently, has recovered from the virus. The actor has also resumed promotions for his film 'Prithviraj'. Akshay had shared the news of his diagnosis on May 14, saying, "Was really looking forward to rooting for our cinema at the India Pavilion at #Cannes2022, but have sadly tested positive for COVID."

277.title: India needs clear regulation for crypto investments: Binance exec
277.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange Binance APAC Head Leon Foong in an interview discussing cryptocurrency investments in India said, "A clear, progressive, and pro-innovation regulatory framework is necessary in giving investors comfort and certainty that India is the right place to be putting their money." He added blockchain startups are what brought the attention of Binance and many investors in India.

278.title: Temple's character can't change with demolition: BJP leader
278.article_body: Amid the ongoing Gyanvapi mosque case, BJP leader and lawyer Ashwini Upadhyay said that a temple's religious character does not change after the demolition of roof, walls, pillars, foundation and even offering namaz. "After the 'pran pratishtha' of idol, a temple always remains a temple until the idol is shifted to another temple with the rituals of 'visharjan'," he added.

279.title: Cancel water theft FIRs against 32 farmers: SAD chief to Punjab CM
279.article_body: Shiromani Akali Dal (SAD) chief Sukhbir Singh Badal has asked Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann to order the cancellation of water theft FIRs immediately that have been registered against 32 farmers in Fazilka. The irrigation department officials, who were "failing" in their duty to provide requisite water to farmers of the state, were "victimising" them, Badal said.

280.title: Dismissed Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla arrested on corruption charges
280.article_body: Punjab Health Minister Vijay Singla was on Tuesday arrested by the state's Anti-Corruption Branch following complaints of corruption against him. This comes after Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann dismissed Singla from the state Cabinet after receiving "concrete evidence" against him. Singla was allegedly demanding 1% commission from officials for contracts, according to the Chief Minister's Office.

281.title: Hindu deities used in building Qutub Minar complex but can't revive worship there: ASI
281.article_body: The Archaeological Survey of India has told a Delhi court that though it is a fact that architectural images of Hindu and Jain deities were used in the construction of the Qutub Minar complex, revival of worship cannot be allowed. "Revival of worship is not allowed wherever it's not practiced at the time of protection of a monument," it said.

282.title: 20-yr-old man enters 43-yr-old TN woman's house, rapes her at knifepoint
282.article_body: A 20-year-old man was arrested for allegedly raping a 43-year-old woman at knifepoint after stalking her for two days in Tamil Nadu's Chennai. Police said the incident took place on May 20. The man, who was following the woman all day, forcefully barged into her house when she returned from office. He sealed her mouth and raped her, police said.

283.title: 273 cylinders seized as police bust LPG refilling racket in Pune
283.article_body: Pune Rural Police have arrested four people as they busted a liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) refilling racket on Monday. The police also recovered 273 cylinders which were stored illegally and unsafely in Shirur. The arrests were made after the police received a tip-off about the racket, which was being run from a makeshift facility built on a farm.

284.title: I'm crazy about Indian food, I love it to pieces: Jurassic Park actor Goldblum
284.article_body: Hollywood actor Jeff Goldblum, known for starring in films like 'Jurassic Park', 'The Grand Budapest Hotel' and 'Independence Day', has said he's "crazy about Indian food". "I love it to pieces," he added. "I eat too much of it when I have it because it is the most delicious food, I think, on Earth," Goldblum further said.

285.title: Du Plessis' powerplay strike rate is 104, it puts pressure on Kohli: Hogg
285.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg said RCB captain Faf Du Plessis has a strike rate of 104 while batting in powerplay, adding that it puts pressure on Virat Kohli. "Kohli...is not at his best yet," stated Hogg. Talking about LSG captain KL Rahul, Hogg said Rahul's strike rate in powerplay isn't good enough and puts too much pressure on remaining batters.

286.title: I will definitely be with RCB next year, don't know in which capacity yet: AB de Villiers
286.article_body: Former South Africa and RCB wicketkeeper-batter AB de Villiers has said that he will definitely be around the IPL next year. "I will be [with] RCB next year...don't know in which capacity yet," he added. He further said, "I would love to return to my second home (Bengaluru) and I am looking forward to it."

287.title: Swedish fintech startup Klarna lays off 10% staff via prerecorded video message
287.article_body: Swedish fintech startup Klarna on Monday announced that it will lay off 10% of its 7,000 employees. In a prerecorded video message to the employees, CEO Sebastian Siemiatkowski cited the Ukraine war, inflation, "shift in consumer sentiment" and a "highly volatile market" as the reason for layoffs. He added that employees in Europe will receive an "associated compensation".

288.title: 6 of family killed as lorry collides with mini-truck in Haryana's Jind
288.article_body: At least six members of a family and 17 others were injured after a lorry collided head-on with a mini-truck in which they were travelling in Haryana's Jind, police said. As many as 23 persons from the family in Hisar's Narnaund had gone to Haridwar to perform certain religious rites after the death of a family member, police added.

289.title: Confidence of opposition rises immensely on knowing they'll face RCB: Sehwag
289.article_body: Talking about RCB being knocked out in the Eliminator stage of IPL 2020 and IPL 2021, Virender Sehwag said, "The opposition's self confidence increases immensely when they come to know that they are playing RCB." "RCB try their best," added Sehwag. Sehwag jokingly stated that ex-India cricketer Parthiv Patel didn't want RCB to qualify for the playoffs of IPL 2022.

290.title: Starlink will serve everywhere on Earth we're legally allowed: Musk
290.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in response to a Twitter user asking about Starlink's plans for Africa, said, "Starlink will serve everywhere on Earth that we're legally allowed to serve." The user had asked Musk if he had any plans for Starlink's entry to Africa, to which Musk replied, "Yes, first countries in Africa to be announced coming soon."

291.title: Iron shed collapses on workers as crane lifts it in Guj; 3 dead
291.article_body: Three workers were killed and four others critically injured after an iron shed at a rice mill factory in Gujarat's Ahmedabad collapsed on Monday. The incident occurred around 7 pm. The iron shed collapsed on the workers while it was being lifted by a crane, according to the police. The injured workers were taken to a hospital, an inspector said.

292.title: Qatar WC expected to be watched by 5 billion people: FIFA Prez
292.article_body: FIFA President Gianni Infantino has claimed that a global audience of 5 billion is expected to watch this year's football World Cup. "The last women's FIFA World Cup was watched by 1.2 billion people. This World Cup in Qatar will be watched by 5 billion people...way above half of the world's population," Infantino said.

293.title: Plea seeks FIR against Akhilesh, Owaisi for 'hurting religious sentiments'
293.article_body: A plea has been filed against AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi and SP chief Akhilesh Yadav for allegedly "hurting religious sentiments" in name of the Gyanvapi Mosque case and the Kashi Vishwanath temple. Advocate Hari Shankar Pandey filed a petition in the Varanasi court seeking directions to the police to register FIR against seven people, including Yadav, Owaisi and his brother.

294.title: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal flags off 150 new electric AC buses
294.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal flagged off 150 new AC electric buses today and said, "Please take care of them, don't make them dirty." "We launched 150 buses today, 150 more would be added next month. We aim to launch over 2,000 such buses within a year. Over next 10 years, ₹1,862 crore to be spent by Delhi government," Kejriwal said.

295.title: PIL in HC over equal status for 'Vande Mataram', 'Jana Gana Mana'
295.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) has been filed in Delhi High Court seeking a declaration that the poem 'Vande Mataram' will be "honoured equally" to the national anthem 'Jana Gana Mana'. The poem is a "symbol of our history, sovereignty, unity and pride", it said. If a citizen disrespects the poem, it'll "spell doom to all our rights", it added.

296.title: Employee among 3 arrested for burglary at jewellery shop in Bengaluru
296.article_body: The Bengaluru Police on Monday arrested three people for stealing 8 kg of silver articles from a jewellery shop in Chamarajpete. According to police, one of the accused, identified as Rahul, worked at the shop. Rahul had opened two apparel shops in the city and incurred losses. He thus formulated a plan to steal from his employer's shop, police said.

297.title: Egyptian media tycoon jailed for sexually assaulting 7 orphan girls
297.article_body: An Egyptian court has sentenced businessman Mohamed el-Amin to three years in prison for sexually assaulting seven minor girls in an orphanage he founded. He has also been ordered to pay a fine of 200,000 Egyptian pounds (about $11,000). The tycoon, who founded several Egyptian media outlets, was arrested in January after allegations of sexual abuse at the orphanage surfaced.

298.title: Kerala becoming erstwhile Kashmir: BJP on provocative slogans at PFI rally
298.article_body: After a video of a minor boy raising provocative slogans during the Popular Front of India (PFI) rally in Kerala went viral, BJP spokesperson Tom Vadakkan said, "[It] sounds very familiar to what we have heard numerous times in Kashmir...from...'tukde tukde' gang and at...demonstrations which were anti-national." "Kerala is moving towards becoming the erstwhile Kashmir," he added.

299.title: Rohit Shetty runs with 27 kg camera while filming 'Indian...', shares video
299.article_body: Filmmaker Rohit Shetty took to Instagram to share a video from set of 'Indian Police Force'. In the video, Rohit can be seen running with a camera, which he mentioned was 27 kg, while actor Sidharth Malhotra can be seen performing an action sequence. "It's weird how glass breaks...body hits...and staircase falls are normal for us!" Rohit wrote on Instagram.

300.title: I'm Hindu, will eat beef if I want to: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah
300.article_body: Congress' Siddaramaiah said that he is a Hindu who had not consumed beef till now, but he would eat beef if he wanted to. "Beef eaters don't belong to just one community, even Hindus consume beef, Christians consume it as well...I have even said it in Karnataka Assembly. Who are you to tell me to not consume beef?" Siddaramaiah said.

301.title: EV cab platform BluSmart raises $25 mn in extended Series A round
301.article_body: Electric ride-hailing platform ﻿BluSmart﻿ has raised $25 million in an extended Series A round. The funding in the Series A1 round includes $15 million in equity capital, led by BP Ventures and Green Frontier Capital, and venture debt of $10 million. The venture debt funding came from Stride Ventures, Alteria Capital, BlackSoil and UCIC.

302.title: AAP dissolves its Goa working committee, says will reorganise
302.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) dissolved its Goa working committee on Monday, months after the conclusion of the Assembly elections. The party's state incharge Atishi said that the new committee will be reorganised soon. "With expansion of the party in mind…we will constitute a new committee to bring well-meaning and like-minded people into the party's fold," she said.

303.title: 22-year-old man robbed, murdered in Gurugram's IMT Manesar
303.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly murdered and dumped in the IMT Manesar area in Gurugram, police said. The incident took place when the victim was returning home after closing his shop in Aliar village. "The victim's phone was robbed. He suffered injuries on his face, back of the head, arms and back- all inflicted by a sharp object," police added.

304.title: Punjab CM dismisses state Health Minister Vijay Singla on charges of corruption
304.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann has dismissed state Health Minister Vijay Singla following complaints of corruption against him. The Chief Minister's Office said Singla was demanding 1% commission from officials for contracts. Punjab CMO also said that concrete evidence has been found against him. AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal had earlier asked public to record incident if someone asked for bribe.

305.title: Scientists in US start trial on vaccine that prevents pancreatic cancer
305.article_body: US scientists have started a vaccine trial that could prevent pancreatic cancer. Accordingly, a woman with family history of the disease has been given the first jab. Researchers hope the vaccine would equip her body with tools to identify rogue cells that may become cancerous and enable her immune system to launch search and destroy missions to prevent the disease.

306.title: Husband gets 10 years in jail in Kerala student's dowry death case
306.article_body: A Kollam court has sentenced S Kiran Kumar, the husband of Ayurveda medical student Vismaya V Nair who died by suicide in her marital home last year, to 10 years in jail. The court on Monday found him guilty of dowry death and abetting her suicide. Vismaya was 22 years old when she died by suicide on June 21, 2021.

307.title: Ram Gopal Varma booked for cheating a production house of ₹56 lakh
307.article_body: Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma has been booked by police in Hyderabad for allegedly cheating a production house to the tune of ₹56 lakh. This comes after Koppada Sekhar Raju of Sekhara Art Creations lodged a complaint alleging that Varma borrowed money for producing a movie titled 'Disha' with a promise to return the amount before its release but didn't repay.

308.title: Snap to slow down hiring, expects to miss quarterly revenue target
308.article_body: Snap CEO Evan Spiegel has told his employees that the company would significantly slow down hiring for the rest of the year and it may miss its revenue goals for the quarter. Spiegel wrote, "Like many companies, we continue to face rising inflation and interest rates, supply chain shortages and labour disruptions,...the impact of the war in Ukraine, and more."

309.title: Death toll due to Assam floods, landslides rises to 25: ASDMA
309.article_body: As many as 25 people have lost their lives so far due to floods and landslides across the state, Assam State Disaster Management Authority (ASDMA) said. Over 6.5 lakh people remained affected by the floods across 22 districts, it added. As many as 1,709 villages are under water and 82,503 hectares of crop areas have been damaged, ASDMA stated.

310.title: Justin Bieber to return to India after 5 yrs; will perform in Delhi on Oct 18
310.article_body: Singer Justin Bieber is all set to visit India again. He will be performing at Delhi's Jawaharlal Nehru Stadium on October 18 this year. The singer will be visiting India as a part of the world tour that he is doing to promote his latest album 'Justice'. Tickets for the concert will be available on BookMyShow beginning June 4.

311.title: Ex-world no.1 Naomi Osaka knocked out of French Open 2022 in first round
311.article_body: Ex-world number one Naomi Osaka was knocked out in the women's singles first round of French Open 2022 after losing 5-7, 4-6 against Amanda Anisimova. Osaka was playing only her second match on clay this season. Roland Garros 2016 champion Garbiñe Muguruza was earlier knocked out in the first round after being defeated 6-2, 3-6, 4-6 by Kaia Kanepi.

312.title: Construction of Ram Mandir in Ayodhya is in full swing: Temple Trust
312.article_body: Shri Ram Janmbhoomi Teerth Kshetra (SRJBTK) on Monday said that Ram Mandir's construction in Ayodhya is in full swing. While the foundation has been laid, the plinth raising work is still going on, SRJBTK added. "The plinth is raised using granite stone blocks from Karnataka and Telangana. The installation of carved sandstones around the sanctum sanctorum will...commence soon," it said.

313.title: Over 100 activists of Imran Khan's party arrested in Pakistan
313.article_body: Over 100 activists of former PM Imran Khan's party Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf have been reportedly arrested ahead of a planned march to capital Islamabad. The PTI supporters are seeking early elections in the country. The police is said to have acted on the instructions of the ruling PML-N coalition. Most of the arrests were made in Lahore, said a PTI official.

314.title: 2 inter-state gang members arrested for ₹18 lakh bank robbery in Mohali
314.article_body: An inter-state gang of bank robbers was busted by Mohali police and two of its members were arrested who are allegedly involved in ₹18 lakh robbery in Gharuan village. The robbery took place on May 5 at Co-operative Bank’s branch. "This is an inter-state gang which already carried out several bank theft incidents in different states," a police official said.

315.title: 1 person in custody over boy's hate slogans at PFI rally in Kerala
315.article_body: Kerala Police have taken one person into custody during an investigation into a viral video of a minor boy raising provocative slogans allegedly at a Popular Front of India (PFI) rally in Alappuzha. Cases have also been registered against the PFI district president, secretary and other persons. The purported video shows the boy sitting on the shoulders of a person.

316.title: West Bengal cabinet approves to recruit 2,020 women police constables
316.article_body: The West Bengal cabinet on Monday approved to recruit 2,020 women police constables to strengthen the law and order. Out of these, 1,420 constables will be recruited for the 'Winners' squad to check crimes against women, CM Mamata Banerjee said. Besides, 105 special home guards will be appointed in Jangalmahal, a forested region known for Maoist activities earlier, Banerjee added.

317.title: Gene-edited tomatoes could be a new source of vitamin D: Study
317.article_body: Tomatoes could be gene-edited to produce vitamin D that can help reduce deficiency across the world, a study stated. Using gene-editing technique, researchers turned off a specific molecule in the plant's genome that increased provitamin D3 production in both the fruit and leaves of tomato plants. When exposed to UV light, this precursor, provitamin D3, was converted to vitamin D3.

318.title: US President Biden praised PM Modi for his handling of pandemic, criticised China: Report
318.article_body: US President Joe Biden praised PM Narendra Modi for his handling of COVID-19 pandemic and contrasted India's success with China's failure, though both countries are of comparable size, ANI reported quoting an official. He added PM Modi's success showed that democracies can deliver and busted the myth that autocracies like China and Russia can handle the rapidly changing world better.

319.title: Taiwan & Ukraine issue different, absurd to compare them: China to Biden
319.article_body: After US President Joe Biden compared China's military threat to self-ruled Taiwan to Russia's invasion of Ukraine, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesman Wang Wenbin said, "Taiwan...and...Ukraine issues are fundamentally different. To compare those two is absurd." "Taiwan is an inalienable part of the Chinese territory," he added. Biden had said US would defend Taiwan militarily if China invaded it.

320.title: Every time it would play, everybody would start crying: Farah on 'Sandese...’
320.article_body: Choreographer-filmmaker Farah Khan who choreographed the song 'Sandese Aate Hai' from film 'Border' said everybody would start crying every time the song was played, as it was so emotional. "The soldiers, the actors and...I would start crying," added Farah. Farah stated that doing the choreography was very tough, adding she used to be in a different state while shooting it.

321.title: 5 of family on way to Kedarnath killed in road crash in western UP
321.article_body: Five members of a family, including two children, died after their speeding car rammed into a stationary truck on the Bulandshahr-Meerut highway on Tuesday morning. "There were around 10 people of the family inside the Mahindra Scorpio and on way to...Kedarnath shrine," said District Magistrate Chandra Prakash Singh. The other six people suffered injuries in the accident, Singh added.

322.title: Actress Chhavi undergoes radiotherapy after cancer surgery, shares pic of bandaged belly
322.article_body: Actress Chhavi Mittal took to Instagram to share a picture of her bandaged belly after undergoing radiotherapy following her breast cancer surgery. "These beautiful markings you see on my body are to ensure that the radiotherapy is directed towards the correct areas only. I have to keep these till the radiotherapy lasts (1 month)," she wrote.

323.title: We suspect they planned it for months, watched videos: Police on Delhi triple suicide
323.article_body: Police said that they suspect that the three women, who were found dead in their house in Delhi's Vasant Vihar, had been planning the move for months. "The search history on the mobile phones indicates [this]. They also watched videos on YouTube...Their phones have been sent for further examination," Police said, adding that some suicide notes run into multiple pages.

324.title: Tehseen criticises people 'celebrating' failure of Kangana's film, Richa reacts
324.article_body: Richa Chadha has reacted to political analyst Tehseen Poonawalla's tweet wherein he criticised people who are 'celebrating' the box office failure of Kangana Ranaut's 'Dhaakad'. Richa wrote, "Aligning with power is easy and has obvious rewards like tax exemptions, award, security...So do you not know the reverse also holds true Tehseen? People are expressing dissent in whatever way they can."

325.title: Bengaluru CCB busts drug racket, 5 kg marijuana seized
325.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru Police recently busted a drug racket and arrested two drug peddlers. Officials also seized 5 kg marijuana, 260 grams of hashish oil and 20 LSD strips from the accused. The accused were reportedly sourcing drugs from neighbouring states and selling them to their clients, mainly students and IT professionals, in the city.

326.title: Sri Lanka hikes fuel prices; petrol at an all-time high of 420 Sri Lankan rupees
326.article_body: Sri Lanka has raised its petrol and diesel prices by 24.3% and 38.4%, respectively, a record hike in fuel prices amid the nation's worst economic crisis. The Octane 92 petrol would now cost LKR 420/litre and diesel LKR 400/litre, an all-time high. "Work from home will be encouraged to minimise the use of fuel," tweeted Power and Energy Minister.

327.title: Sonam remembers grandmother on her birth anniversary, shares throwback pic
327.article_body: Sonam Kapoor took to her Instagram Stories to share a post remembering her maternal grandmother on her birth anniversary. She shared a throwback picture of her grandmother, and wrote, "Happy Birthday Nani. I miss you." Sonam's maternal grandmother Draupadi Hingorani Bhambani passed away in 2017 at the age of 88.

328.title: 10-yr-old girl forced to drink liquor, sexually assaulted in Pune
328.article_body: A case has been filed against two men for allegedly kidnapping and forcing a 10-year-old speech-impaired girl to drink liquor before sexually assaulting her in Pune. The girl was playing near her residence when the duo had reportedly taken her away on a bike. The incident occurred on May 20 and later, the duo left the girl near her residence.

329.title: Delhivery rises 10% after its shares list at 1.68% premium
329.article_body: Logistics and supply chain startup Delhivery's shares saw a nearly 10% rise in intraday trade on Tuesday after its stock got listed at ₹495.20 apiece, 1.68% over the issue price, on NSE. On BSE, the shares were listed at ₹493 apiece, a premium of 1.2% over its issue price of ₹487. Delhivery had launched its ₹5,235-crore IPO on May 11.

330.title: PM Modi to attend ISB's 20th anniversary in Hyderabad on May 26
330.article_body: Hyderabad's Indian School of Business (ISB) Dean Madan Pillutla told reporters on Monday that PM Narendra Modi will be attending the institute's 20th-anniversary celebrations on May 26. He said that PM Modi will also plant a sapling, unveil a commemorative plaque and launch ISB MyStamp and Special Cover. The PM will address the graduation ceremony of 930 students, he added.

331.title: Man held by Pune Police in MHADA job paper leak case, 11 held so far
331.article_body: A 31-year-old man, identified as Kanchan Shrimant Salve, was held by the Pune Police's Cyber Cell in connection with the Maharashtra Housing and Area Development Authority (MHADA) job exam paper leak case. This was the 11th arrest made in the case. However, 80 people, including an IAS officer, have been arrested till now in the five interconnected government recruitment cases.

332.title: Monitor for monkeypox cases, isolate for treatment: TN govt to officials
332.article_body: Tamil Nadu government has directed District Collectors and Commissioners of Corporations to monitor people who have travelled in last 21 days to countries that have recently reported confirmed or suspected cases of monkeypox. State Health and Family Welfare Principal Secretary said that suspected cases should be isolated and contact tracing should be done if a positive case is detected.

333.title: T20 Blast is the best T20 competition in the world: Ex-Eng player Lloyd
333.article_body: Ex-England cricketer David Lloyd said the T20 Blast is the world's best T20 competition because of the joy it brings to spectators. "The T20 Blast is for the people and bringing money into the game. That's a major factor...in saying it is the best," added Lloyd. "[The IPL] is a private enterprise and [is] benefiting already wealthy people," stated Lloyd.

334.title: Karan Johar to host a theme party for his 50th birthday at Yash Raj Studios
334.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar will turn 50 on May 25. To celebrate his birthday, he will host a grand theme party at Yash Raj Studios. While the theme of the party is black and bling, the entire setup of the bash will be designed by Amrita Mahal, who has worked on creating the sets of films like 'Kalank' and  'Brahmastra'.

335.title: I would give him 100/100 as a captain: Mohammad Kaif on Hardik Pandya
335.article_body: Ex-India batter Mohammad Kaif said he would give GT captain Hardik Pandya 100 marks out of 100 for his captaincy in IPL 2022 so far. "Hardik has been excellent. He stands at mid-off and keeps interacting with bowlers," added Kaif. "The management...has worked well with the players. After the mega auction many people did not rate them highly," stated Kaif.

336.title: Mumbai local trains on Harbour line disrupted due to power issue
336.article_body: Local train services on the Harbour line in Mumbai were disrupted on Tuesday morning due to power issue. As per Central Railway official, services on the up line (towards Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus in south Mumbai) on the Harbour corridor were held up for about 15 minutes. Nearly 10 lakh commuters reportedly travel daily on the Harbour line.

337.title: 12 booked for raising pro-Pak slogans in Jharkhand's Hazaribag
337.article_body: As many as 12 people were booked for allegedly raising pro-Pakistan slogans during the victory procession of a panchayat samiti member in Jharkhand's Hazaribag. A video of the incident that occurred on May 19 reportedly went viral on social media, following which an FIR was registered. Police said they are investigating the matter and no arrests have been made yet.

338.title: Disappointed with my batting in last few games: Buttler ahead of Qualifier 1
338.article_body: Ahead of the IPL Qualifier One game, Rajasthan Royals batter Jos Buttler has said that he is "disappointed" with his batting performance in the last few matches. "[In] the first half (of IPL) I was playing some of the best cricket I've ever played," Buttler said. "I've obviously been delighted with my form in the IPL," the 31-year-old cricketer added.

339.title: 86 mn-yr-old fossils of flying reptile species found in Argentina
339.article_body: An ancient flying reptile species, called 'The Dragon of Death', that lived 86 million years ago has been discovered in Argentina. Scientists found rocks preserving the reptile's remains in the Andes mountains in Argentina's western Mendoza province. The species predated birds as among the first creatures on Earth to use wings to hunt its prey from prehistoric skies, scientists estimated.

340.title: Odisha church shut amid reports of religious conversions, Sec 144 imposed
340.article_body: A church in Geltua in Odisha's Bhadrak has been shut amid reports of religious conversions and the district administration has imposed Section 144 in the area. Only three persons are allowed to gather in the vicinity of the church, it added. "There were complaints regarding tribals being converted to Christianity," Sub-Collector of Bhadrak Manoj Patra said.

341.title: 61 Pune policemen booked in 37 cases for criminal offences in 4 years
341.article_body: As many as 61 policemen have been booked in four years in 37 cases for criminal offences like rape, molestation, corruption and others, according to Pune Police data. As many as eight cases have been lodged in 2022. In 2021, 12 cases were lodged, of which six were related to corruption and rape, and two were for molestation.

342.title: Committed to make US-India partnership among the closest on Earth: Biden to PM Modi
342.article_body: US President Joe Biden in a bilateral meeting with PM Narendra Modi in Tokyo on Tuesday said, "There is so much that our countries can and will do together. I'm committed to make US-India partnership among the closest we have on Earth." "India and US strategic partnership in the true sense is a partnership of trust," said PM Modi.

343.title: Missing Haryanvi singer's body found after 12 days, family says 'She was only in underwear'
343.article_body: The body of a Haryanvi singer, who had been missing for 12 days, was found mutilated and buried near a highway in Rohtak. Delhi Police arrested two men for allegedly kidnapping and killing her, saying the accused called her on the pretext of making a music video. Meanwhile, her family said, "She had no clothes on except her underwear."

344.title: Head of Akal Takht asks to phase out harmoniums from Golden Temple
344.article_body: Akal Takht Jathedar Giani Harpreet Singh has asked Shiromani Gurdwara Parbandhak Committee (SGPC) to phase out use of harmonium from Golden Temple and replace it with more traditional string instruments. Harmonium is an instrument with colonial roots therefore not an appropriate instrument for 'Gurbani', the Takht said. The Takht administration has given three years deadline to remove harmoniums.

345.title: Haryana Police arrest 2 men for cheating job aspirant’s father of ₹7 lakh
345.article_body: Haryana Police arrested two Punjab residents for allegedly cheating a Kurukshetra resident of ₹7 lakh on pretext of providing a job to his daughter at Delhi's Indira Gandhi National Open University. "Complainant alleged that the duo told him that he would have to pay ₹7 lakh as advance and ₹8 lakh after the work was done," a police spokesperson said.

346.title: Won't need mass vaccinations, just practise safe sex and good hygiene: WHO on monkeypox
346.article_body: The World Health Organization (WHO) has stated that the monkeypox outbreak won't need mass vaccinations like COVID-19, adding that it doesn't spread easily or cause serious disease. Richard Pebody, the head of the WHO's pathogen threat team in Europe, cautioned people to practise safe sex, good hygiene practices, and regular handwashing to avoid infection.

347.title: Zomato shares surge 18% despite ₹360-crore loss in Q4 earnings
347.article_body: Zomato shares surged by 18% during intraday trade on Tuesday, a day after the company announced its March quarter earnings. The firm reported a loss of around ₹360 crore in the fourth quarter, nearly triple from its net loss of ₹134 crore in the year-ago period. At ₹1,211.8 crore, its revenue surged by 75% as against ₹692.4 crore in Q4FY21.

348.title: Quad is not just a passing fad, we mean business: US Prez Biden
