348.article_body: Quad is "not just a passing fad, but it means business", US President Joe Biden said, addressing the second in-person meeting between Quad leaders on Tuesday. "We're here to get things done for the region and I'm proud of what we're building together and I look forward to our vital partnership flourishing and for many years to come," Biden added.

349.title: AAP’s Delhi model can’t be replicated everywhere: Himachal CM
349.article_body: AAP’s Delhi model may have worked but they do not have a long-term model for being successful, Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said. "The model cannot be replicated everywhere as each place has a different set of characteristics," Thakur added. "It worked in Punjab but in Himachal, other parties have failed. Mayawati tried, SP tried...none of them succeeded," he stated.

350.title: Punjab AAP MLA, wife & son convicted in 2011 assault case; get bail
350.article_body: Punjab AAP MLA Balbir Singh, his wife, son and an aide were on Monday sentenced to three years of rigorous imprisonment in a 2011 assault case by a court in Rupnagar. However, the four accused were later granted bail. According to an FIR, the accused had allegedly attacked Singh's sister-in-law and her husband following a land dispute.

351.title: 20-yr-old engineering graduate held with 98 fake currency notes in Guj
351.article_body: A 20-year-old resident of Ahmedabad’s Sola was arrested with 98 fake Indian currency notes of ₹2,000 each. The accused, an engineering graduate, was acting on behest of the main conspirator who hired him as a porter. The main accused used to ask him to purchase mobile phones and other gadgets using the currency, resell them and receive genuine currency notes.

352.title: Australia to prioritise action on climate change: PM Albanese at Quad
352.article_body: Australian PM Anthony Albanese underlined the need to recognise climate change as the main economic and security challenge for the island nations of the Pacific. Addressing the Quad summit, he said, "The new Australian government gives priority to taking action on climate change and building a more resilient Indo-Pacific region through economic, cyber, energy, health and environmental security."

353.title: Musk lost $10 bn net worth in a single day after sexual harassment claims emerged
353.article_body: Elon Musk lost $10 billion of his net worth in a single day after sexual harassment allegations against him were reported. Musk's wealth was about $212 billion on Thursday as per the Bloomberg Billionaires Index, it fell to $201 billion after the report emerged. Currently, at $204 billion on the index, he is still the richest person in the world.

354.title: FTX CEO on TIME's 100 most influential people of 2022 list
354.article_body: Cryptocurrency exchange FTX CEO Sam Bankman-Fried was featured in TIME's 100 most influential people of 2022 list. Bankman-Fried was featured in the 'Titans' section alongside Apple CEO Tim Cook and Amazon CEO Andy Jassy. The list also featured India's richest person Gautam Adani, SC advocate Karuna Nundy and Kashmiri human rights activist Khurram Parvez.

355.title: Group opens fire, stone pelts house in road rage incident in Punjab
355.article_body: A case was filed after a group allegedly opened fire, pelted stones at a house and vandalised vehicles in a road rage incident in Punjab's Ludhiana. A man's car had apparently brushed against one of the accused's vehicles, following which they abused him. Later, the man reached his sister's house and the accused reportedly also came there and pelted stones.

356.title: Feeling bad I hurt my fans, they see me as Sita: Dipika on school uniform pics
356.article_body: Dipika Chikhlia, known for portraying Sita in 'Ramayan', has reacted after getting trolled for posting pictures of herself in school uniform on Instagram. In the now-deleted post, Dipika was seen posing with her friends in a shirt, skirt and tie. Dipika said, "I'm feeling bad...I've hurt my fans...I'm aware...people see me as Sita, not as Dipika...it was...mistake on my part."

357.title: Love you forever and beyond: Aishwarya wishes her mom on b'day
357.article_body: Actress Aishwarya Rai, along with husband Abhishek Bachchan and daughter Aaradhya Bachchan, visited her mother Vrinda Rai to wish her on her birthday. Taking to Instagram, Aishwarya shared a few pictures from the birthday celebration. She also shared a solo picture of her mother and captioned it, "Happy birthday dearest darling mommy-doddaaa. Love you forever and beyond. God bless always."

358.title: 5 dept heads, 3 deputy commissioners appointed in unified MCD
358.article_body: After the Municipal Corporation of Delhi unification, five departmental heads and three deputy commissioners have been appointed to the capital's civic body. The three deputy commissioners are deputed to the Civil Lines zone, Rohini zone, and Hackney Carriage, Language, Disaster Management and Election, the order said. Notably, the unified MCD formally came into existence on Sunday.

359.title: Cyber crime cases in Mumbai surged by 200% in January-April period: Data
359.article_body: There has been a nearly 200 percent increase in cyber crime cases in Mumbai during January to April period this year, compared to the cases registered during the same period last year, Mumbai Police data showed. As per the data, 1,468 cyber crime cases were registered this year, as compared to 777 cases registered last year between January and April.

360.title: We should never allow Ukraine-like situation in Indo-Pacific: Japan PM at Quad
360.article_body: At the Quad summit in Tokyo, Japanese PM Fumio Kishida said that the Russian invasion of Ukraine challenges the principles which are enshrined in the United Nations Charter. "We should never ever allow a similar incident to happen in the Indo-Pacific region," he added. He urged the international community to listen to the voices of Asian countries.

361.title: 5 dead, at least 80 trapped as 10-storey building collapses in Iran
361.article_body: At least five people were killed after an under-construction 10-storey building collapsed in Iran's Abadan city, Iranian state TV reported on Monday. At least 80 people are still believed to be trapped under the rubble. The owner of the building and the contractor who built it have been arrested, state TV said, quoting local prosecutor Hamid Maranipour said.

362.title: Shreya can read 6 pages of dialogues and remember every word: Dia Mirza
362.article_body: Talking about actress Shreya Dhanwanthary who starred in 'Scam 1992: The Harshad Mehta Story', actress Dia Mirza said, "I didn't know that Shreya has a photographic memory. She can read 6 pages of dialogues and remember every word." "She's also an amazing singer. I discovered it because she was embarrassing the life out of me by singing songs," added Dia.

363.title: Mob came prepared to destroy documents, records were burnt: Assam Police
363.article_body: While talking about the police station that was set ablaze in Assam by a mob on Saturday, Leena Doley, the Nagaon Police Superintendent, said evidence shows that the mob had come prepared to attack the police station and destroy documents. "Many case diaries and other records kept in the building were burnt...We have managed to retrieve some weapons," she added.

364.title: BSF apprehends 20-yr-old Bangladeshi man in Meghalaya
364.article_body: The Border Security Force (BSF) on Sunday apprehended a 20-year-old Bangladeshi national who entered the Indian territory from the bordering area of East Khasi Hills in Meghalaya. He was trying to hide in the bushes when BSF troops intercepted him, the BSF said. He illegally entered India to go to West Bengal and earn a livelihood, BSF added.

365.title: Hrithik didn't want to sing a line from 'Ek Pal...', it was retained: Lucky
365.article_body: Discussing his song 'Ek Pal Ka Jeena' from Hrithik Roshan starrer 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar Hai', Lucky Ali said, "I had an issue with the word 'aas' in the line, 'Ek chehra khaas hai, milne ki aas hai'." "I discussed this with Hrithik who told music director Rajesh Roshan he didn't want the line," added Lucky. "It was retained," stated Lucky.

366.title: BSF arrests two Indian smugglers with gold worth over ₹6 crore
366.article_body: The BSF on Monday arrested two Indian smugglers with gold worth ₹6.15 crore in two separate incidents in West Bengal. In one incident, a truck driver was arrested for smuggling 70 gold biscuits and three gold bars. While in another incident, a motorcyclist was apprehended with four gold biscuits. The accused were trying to smuggle gold from Bangladesh, BSF stated.

367.title: 14 bodies found on Myanmar beach after boat capsizes
367.article_body: As many as 14 bodies were reportedly found washed up on a Myanmar beach after a boat carrying a group of 61 people trying to reach Malaysia capsized. 35 people, including the boat owners, were rescued alive, said police. According to UNHCR, the deceased include Rohingyas. It said that the tragedy shows the desperation felt by Rohingyas in Myanmar.

368.title: Christian Bale's look as villain Gorr in 'Thor: Love and Thunder' goes viral
368.article_body: Actor Christian Bale's look as villain Gorr the God Butcher in 'Thor: Love and Thunder' has gone viral. The look was introduced to the fans in the film's new trailer. "Christian Bale as Gorr looks terrifying. Love it," a fan commented. "Christian Bale looks crazily good as Gorr!" wrote another.

369.title: Priyanka hosts party at LA home for manager, dances to dhol; video surfaces
369.article_body: Priyanka Chopra hosted a birthday party for her manager Anjula Acharia at her Los Angeles home on Monday where she even danced to live dhol. A video surfaced where Priyanka can be seen coming out of the room holding a two-tier cake. Anjula also shared several pictures from the party and thanked Priyanka for the celebration.

370.title: WB facing ₹1,141 cr revenue loss due to fuel duties reduction: Mamata
370.article_body: West Bengal is facing a total revenue loss of ₹1,141 crore due to reduction of duties on petrol and diesel, CM Mamata Banerjee said. "There is an automatic state tax deduction of ₹1.80 on petrol...₹1.03 on diesel," Mamata added. This comes after the Centre reduced excise duty on petrol by ₹8 per litre and on diesel by ₹6 a litre.

371.title: Motera, not Eden, is my home ground: Wriddhiman Saha
371.article_body: The Gujarat Titans wicketkeeper Wriddhiman Saha has said that Ahmedabad's Motera Stadium is his "home ground" and not Kolkata's Eden Gardens. "My home ground is Motera...Since I'm no longer with KKR," said Saha ahead of their IPL Qualifier One match against Rajasthan Royals at Eden Gardens. Notably, the 37-year-old player has represented Bengal in his entire first-class cricket career.

372.title: India ships rice, other essentials worth ₹43 cr to crisis-hit Sri Lanka
372.article_body: India delivered its first consignment of humanitarian aid worth ₹43 crore to the crisis-hit Sri Lanka on Sunday. Gopal Baglay, the Indian envoy to Sri Lanka, delivered the aid that included rice, milk powder and essential medicines to Sri Lanka's Foreign Minister Gamini Peiris. These goods will be distributed among vulnerable families across the country.

373.title: I am testing Starlink on my plane, it's working quite well: Musk
373.article_body: SpaceX CEO Elon Musk in response to a Twitter user's question about him using Starlink on his plane said, "I am testing Starlink on the plane. Some polishing [is] needed, but it's working quite well." The Twitter user had also asked Musk what he does on a plane, to which he said, "I work."

374.title: Jail officials took his mosquito net citing rules: Gautam Navlakha's partner
374.article_body: Sahba Husain, partner of human rights activist Gautam Navlakha who was arrested in Elgar Parishad-Bhima Koregaon case, said that prison officials, citing rules, have suddenly taken away the mosquito net that Navlakha was using on recommendation of doctor. Navlakha has approached the special National Investigation Agency (NIA) court seeking a mosquito net.

375.title: 'Anek' is not a 100 cr film, it's an important film: Ayushmann
375.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana has called his upcoming movie 'Anek' an "important film", adding that it's "not a 100 crore film". "You can't view Anek through a commercial lens," he added. "You get courage from your commercially successful films to do films like Anek and Article 15," Ayushmann further said. Directed by Anubhav Sinha, 'Anek' is set to release on May 27.

376.title: Greek PM no longer exists for me: Turkish Prez Erdogan
376.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said that Greek PM Kyriakos Mitsotakis "no longer exists" for him, accusing Mitsotakis of trying to block sales of F-16 jets to Turkey during a visit to America last week. "I'll never agree to meet with him," he added. Turkey and Greece have been at odds over several issues, such as maritime boundaries and airspace.

377.title: India reports 1,675 new COVID-19 cases, 31 deaths in last 24 hours
377.article_body: India has reported 1,675 COVID-19 cases, 1,635 recoveries and 31 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 2,022 COVID-19 cases and 46 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 14,841, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,490.

378.title: It's a dream come true for me: Mahesh Babu on film with Rajamouli
378.article_body: Mahesh Babu has said he's very excited about his next film with 'RRR' director SS Rajamouli. "It's a dream come true for me. We've been trying to collaborate for a long time and it's finally happening," he added. Mahesh further said he loves the action genre and credited Rajamouli for taking it to "an altogether new level".

379.title: T'gana BJP workers to go door-to-door to brief people on welfare schemes
379.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Tarun Chugh said that the state BJP workers would inform people about the party's welfare schemes on the completion of eight years of PM Modi's government. "BJP workers will go to every house for 14 days and brief [people]," Chugh said. The program will be started by JP Nadda in Delhi from May 30, he added.

380.title: 7 dead, 26 injured as bus collides with lorry in Karnataka's Hubballi
380.article_body: At least seven people died and 26 were injured after a passenger bus collided with a lorry on the outskirts of Karnataka's Hubballi, police said on Tuesday. The accident took place when the bus driver was trying to overtake a tractor, police added. Notably, the drivers of both the vehicles died on the spot, police further said.

381.title: Ukraine a global issue, not just a European one: Biden in Asia
381.article_body: The crisis in Ukraine is "more than just a European issue, it's a global issue", US President Joe Biden said at a meeting of the Quad grouping of countries in Tokyo. "We're Indo-Pacific powers. As long as Russia continues...war, we're going to be partners and lead a global response," he added. The Quad comprises India, the US, Japan and Australia.

382.title: Activision illegally threatened staff over social media policy: US NLRB
382.article_body: The US NLRB has said that 'Call of Duty' maker Activision Blizzard enforced a social media policy that conflicted with workers' rights and allegedly illegally threatened staff in the policy's enforcement. "These allegations are false. Employees may and do talk freely about these workplace issues without retaliation," the firm said. It added its social media policy doesn't restrict communication.

383.title: BJP searches votes in temples, we search God in Shivling: Cong leader
383.article_body: The BJP searches for votes in the temple while the Congress searches for "God in Shivling", Congress leader Pramod Krishnam said. He was speaking on the Shivling claimed to be found inside the Gyanvapi Mosque. "Our party works on the ideology of 'Sarvdharm Sambhav'. We are followers of Mahatma Gandhi. Will follow court's judgement," Krishnam added.

384.title: Bihar journalist who reported on liquor, sand mafias shot dead
384.article_body: A 26-year-old journalist, Subhash Kumar Mahto, was shot dead outside his house while returning from a community dinner in Bihar's Begusarai on Friday. The victim's family claimed his reporting on liquor and sand mafias in the region was the reason he was killed. However, the police said a verbal spat during a wedding celebration could be the reason.

385.title: Hyderabad Police averts child marriage, minor girl rescued
385.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police on Monday informed that a child marriage attempt was averted in Ambothu Thanda village, under Manchal police station. A She Team from Ibrahimpatnam division, along with officials from Childline stopped the wedding and rescued the minor girl, police said. According to Rachakonda Police, the She Teams have prevented about 11 child marriages in past eight weeks.

386.title: Disappointed how WHO report on excess COVID-19 deaths prepared: India at Geneva
386.article_body: Addressing the 75th World Health Assembly in Geneva on Monday, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said, "India would like to express its disappointment over the manner in which the report by WHO on all-cause excess mortality was prepared and published." He added that the concerns expressed by India and other countries over the methodology and sources of data were ignored.

387.title: Serum Institute planning to set up its 1st manufacturing plant in Africa
387.article_body: The Serum Institute of India is planning to set up its first manufacturing plant in Africa in its efforts to expand globally. CEO Adar Poonawalla said he was meeting African officials in Davos for the same and also said that such projects usually require an investment of around $300 million. He didn't mention what products the African plant might make.

388.title: 8 ex-MLAs join Congress in Haryana, 'party on comeback' says Hooda
388.article_body: As many as eight former MLAs joined Congress in Haryana on Monday. They include Sharda Rathore, Ram Niwas Ghorela, Naresh Selwal, Parminder Singh Dhull, Zile Ram Sharma, Rakesh Kamboj, Rajkumar Valmiki and Subhash Chaudhary. "The party is on a comeback in Haryana," Congress leader and former CM Bhupinder Singh Hooda said on the occasion.

389.title: I don't enjoy drawing a line on butter, I do it on a stone: PM Modi in Tokyo
389.article_body: During his interaction with Indian community in Tokyo, PM Narendra Modi said the values he has imbibed in his life helped him develop a tough resolve to face life's challenges. "Mujhe makhan par lakeer karne mein maza nahi aata hain...main patthar par lakeer karta hoon (I don't enjoy drawing a line on butter...I do it on a stone)," he stated.

390.title: Sang 2 songs for 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar hai', haven't watched the film: Lucky Ali
390.article_body: Singer-songwriter Lucky Ali said that he sang two numbers for the film 'Kaho Naa... Pyaar hai' but hasn't watched the film yet. "[It's] not because of any reason...It just didn't happen," he said. Lucky also said that the first four lines of the song 'Ek Pal Ka Jeena' were contributed by him. "Lyricist Vijay Akela developed on that," he added.

391.title: Unlike Shakhas they teach empathy: Owaisi on Assam CM’s ‘madrasa’ remark
391.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi reacted to Assam CM Himanta Biswa Sarma’s 'madrasa' remark, saying that they teach self-respect and empathy “unlike Shakhas”. "Illiterate Sanghis wouldn’t understand. Why did Hindu social reformer Raja Ram Mohan Roy study in a madrasa?" Owaisi tweeted. "Obsessing over Muslim ancestry shows your inferiority complex," he added.

392.title: Body of 1 out of 2 farmers trapped in 40-ft-deep tubewell pit in Hisar found
392.article_body: The body of one of the two farmers, who got trapped in 40-foot-deep tubewell pit after portion of land collapsed on them in Hisar on Sunday, has been retrieved. The army and NDRF teams dug about 53 feet into the pit, but the other farmer hasn't been traced yet as gusty winds accumulated loose soil inside the pit, police said.

393.title: Ghaziabad gets ₹15 cr to carry out air quality improvement measures
393.article_body: Ghaziabad, which ranked as the second-most polluted city as per World Air Quality Report-2021, received ₹15 crore for air quality improvement. The city is already listed among 16 non-attainment areas in UP, suffering from high levels of pollution. "It is expected that this is one of the instalments and we are likely to receive more funds," Ghaziabad Municipal Commissioner said.

394.title: Noida Authority to cover stormwater drains after residents complain
394.article_body: The Noida Authority has decided to begin covering the city's stormwater drains with slabs after several residents complained of foul smell, because of garbage, emanating from them. Before covering the drains, the authority is going to repair the banks of the drains, an official said. In the first phase, the authority will take up only 10 drains, the official added.

395.title: YSR Congress Party MLC held on charges of murdering his driver: Police
395.article_body: YSR Congress Party MLC Ananta Satya Uday Bhaskar was arrested in Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada for allegedly murdering his former driver, police said. "He was also charged with screening of evidence...sought to portray it as an accident," Kakinada SP said. Bhaskar allegedly hit the victim during an argument, following which he fell on an iron grill and sustained a head injury.

396.title: Tesla still believes in ESG: Investor after Musk calls it 'scam'
396.article_body: Tesla investor John Streur has said the automaker still believes in ESG indexes after it was cut from S&P 500 ESG Index last week. Streur's comment comes after Tesla CEO Elon Musk criticised S&P Global Ratings and called ESG a "scam". Asked if Musk believes in ESG, Streur said, "I can't speak for him, but I think his company does."

397.title: Tried to be oversmart when I was young, got thrashed miserably: Nawazuddin
397.article_body: Actor Nawazuddin Siddiqui said he tried to be oversmart when he was young, adding he was thrashed miserably. "We were playing a match on the field and another team insisted on playing first...so I went near him and said, 'What are you saying?'. He looked at me, picked up a bamboo stick and thrashed me so badly," stated Nawazuddin.

398.title: Airbnb to close its business in China amid tight COVID-19 restrictions
398.article_body: Airbnb is shutting down its domestic business in China amid the country's tight COVID-19 restrictions. All listings for homes in the country will be removed from July 30. While Airbnb set up its business in China in 2016, stays in the country accounted for only 1% of the company's revenue over the last few years.

399.title: He used to say 'I haven't faced camera for 30 yrs': Dalip on Rajiv Kapoor
399.article_body: Speaking about working with late actor, Rajiv Kapoor in 'Toolsidas Junior', actor Dalip Tahil said,  "He had...many doubts. He told me 'I have not faced camera for 30 years' and I thought 'What is all this talk about nepotism'." "He (Rajiv) was...excited [for the film] and [did] a great job after the first few days of nervousness," he added.

400.title: No new 'fever' deaths, COVID-19 situation stable: North Korea
400.article_body: North Korea on Tuesday said there were no new deaths among "fever" patients in the country, the first time since it confirmed a COVID-19 outbreak on May 12. The country is seeing a "stable" downward trend in pandemic-related cases, state news agency KCNA said. North Korea has reported nearly three million 'fever' cases and 68 deaths so far, KCNA added.
